Reviews.Title: “La trip and stay at crowne plaza beverly hills”
Reviews.Author: wombatboi
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed 5 nights at this hotel. The value for money at this hotel is excellent, it is basically only 2 kms or so from where you need to go shopping and restaurant wise. It has cabs out front and its own limo service. Its located quite close to santa monica which is worth a Days look, great place. Davanie womack the concierge is excellent, she organised numerous limo rides, made calls and booked me lakers tickets. The hotel itself has all the basics and comfy king size beds. Dont expect amazing quality finishes in the rooms but if youre like me you wont care as the bed and other facilites are all there. I rate it a 4/5 mainly for value for money and location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: robo64
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is in a great location as it is nearby to all Beverley Hills attractions. The Staff are very freindly and Hospitable. They go out of their way to make your stay pleasant and are so very helpful. The rooms are spacious and very clean. The Restaurant serves great food and my son loved the room, service. We stayed 10 nights and would definately come back for another stay.

Reviews.Title: “HELPFUL STAFF”
Reviews.Author: Robert J
Reviews.Content: The staff are very friendly and eager to help. Julio at the front desk gave us awesome instructions on how to use the bus and train system to get to Hollywood Boulevard. Romel was also very helpful with taking our luggage up to our room and giving us some quick information on the city. We were very tired on arrival and the wonderful staff checked us in early so we could rest. Food is good quality and well priced. THANKS CROWNE PLAZA!! Abbey, Sophie and Robert.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Steve K
Reviews.Content: Very welcoming hotel, friendly rooms a good size and the staff helpful. The restaurant is excellent. Could not fault it. Will definately return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel with lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: Andrea E
Reviews.Content: After much research we decided on the Crowne Plaza Beverly Hills as we wanted to stay in a good area but not spend too much, when we first arrived it was quite early and we were very tired, expecting that we would have to wait until later in the day to check in, we were actually offered a room straight away or to wait 2 hours for one on a higher floor. We made the decision to wait as weren't in too much hurry, so went to the local Beverly Hills Plaza shopping centre, when we returned after 1.5hrs the room was ready and we were also upgraded to the top floor and given complimentary breakfast every morning, we didn't expect that but were thoroughly delighted. Room was reasonably quiet, no noise from street as we were facing back of hotel, some noise from guests as we were in an adjoining room but person next door was very considerate so hardly heard him, occasional noise from hallway at night with slamming doors and people not realising they were being a bit loud. Overall a really good stay. I can't say enough about the staff, the lady who checked us in, Chanelle (I think was her name) was gorgeous and so cheerful, the doormen were chirpy with a lovely sense of humour and you really felt recognised and welcomed as part of the family each time you returned from another adventure, the conceirge Daryl was thoroughly excellent and couldn't do enough for us, what an asset to the hotel, we gave him a bottle of wine upon our departure to say thanks as he was such a nice person to deal with. We were there for 4 nights and given the chance again we will definitely be back, although the rooms were nice it's the staff that made this place and they are exceptional. Location was okay, area very safe to walk around, approx 10-20min walk up South Beverly drive to get to local restaurants, we frequented the Cheesecake Factory several times throughout our stay for dinner, they were exceptional and only 15-20mins walk straight up road on same side. As LA is very spread out we had to take cabs or buses to the likes of Century city, Santa Monica Blvd and Hollywood but bus stop right outside hotel and cabs rank also right outside hotel and weren't expensive, Rodeo Drive approx 25mins walk from hotel or 7mins in cab. Staff at hotel very knowledgeable on how to get to places the right way without spending a fortune. Would recommend this hotel, just a nice place to stay and excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent start to our US trip”
Reviews.Author: MCRAD16
Reviews.Content: Our very first US hotel and we are delighted with our travel agent's choice. Travelling with another family member we were unsure of rooms being adjacent. This was not a problem. One of the many great things about this hotel, which we believe is one of the main advantages, is the staff. From the gentleman on the front desk to the gentleman on the door, from Deming in the Bar/Breakfast room who was spot on with his smile and input, to Jesus C in the Bar/Breakfast Room who always helpful; many thanks to Daryl (your management should send you to each and every restaurant you recommend, so that you can recommend first hand), Jose, Chantelle, Luis and Kenny. The beds were comfortable, the pillows unbelievable, the rooms were clean, the restaurant was good although could offer more choices on week nights, and most of all we felt very safe at this hotel. We would recommend this hotel to friends and family. Internet in the rooms was very much appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “This is not a 3 star a 1* or 2** two perhaps - extra for parking and no Fridge”
Reviews.Author: ElGuapo_9
Reviews.Content: After booking it for 4 people, they assign us a room for 2 and said they have no moe rooms. (we booked on Hotwire). After a talk to the manager, we were given a room for 4. (even aftr they said they had no more rooms. Then when we go to the room it was second rate. There was a huge blotch on the carpet, about 5' across. When looing for a sock under the skirting of the bed I found someones cacy wrappers, and a large letter from New York. The covers on the bed had a cluster of spots on it, about 1' by 2'. They first said that they had no room for 4 people, they were booked up, Then they asssisgned us one after I talked to the manager, Then they said we should have booked the hotel through them direct ...then things would have been different. I suspect that since we were booked on hotwire they gave us a unrennovated (second rate rooms).

Reviews.Title: “Lovely but maybe not the best spot for us”
Reviews.Author: Allison H
Reviews.Content: The staff, breakfast buffet, pool and spa, and location were great though we later realised that it might have been better to stay closer to Santa Monica as that is more family oriented. The beds were not that comfortable and our double room was quite cramped for the three of us. We could walk to rodeo drive but it was a decent walk. Easy local bus ride to Santa Monica. We caught tour bus to universal studios which turned out to be very complicated as they took us to Hollywood to lineup again rather than direct to universal. Concierge Davinia was lovely and staff were all very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “rojo”
Reviews.Author: travellerMooroolbark
Reviews.Content: having had a bad experience with accommodation in LA last year, was very hesitant about my stay this time. I shouldn't have worried. This hotel was all about being helpful and friendly. The front staff of James and Dennis were amazing. James in particular was a pleasure to talk with. The bar staff / restuarant staff were also fantastic. I would definately recommend this hotel to anyone. Great location and comfortable rooms

Reviews.Title: “A Simply Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: houstonguy2010
Reviews.Content: From the moment I called the hotel to inquire about the speed of the internet service to check out this hotel gave outstanding service. I spoke with a front office manager named Riley who from the moment he answered the phone made me feel like the entire hotel was here to serve only me. I know that is not the case. We arrived by cab and our luggage was removed from the cab by the hotel staff. Check in was quick and the front desk clerk was so very nice. And nice in a genuine way, not a fake type of nice. We had a room on the 11th floor as we are Priority Club members. A wonderful view to say the least. A nice 42 inch flat screen tv, a clean room and beds that were ever so comfortable. Everytime we left or returned to the hotel the door was opened for us. And upon return someone always said welcome back. The night prior to check out our phone rang. The front desk asking if we needed a wake up call and thanking us for staying at the hotel. This will be my choice of hotel when in the LA area. Customer service is truly the key to success and this hotel has it perfect.....Thanks Crowne Plaza for a truly perfect stay.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, easy.”
Reviews.Author: Caroline B
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel. We had a view of downtown and the Hollywood sign from our room (although it was a long way in the distance). The pool was clean and warm for this time of year (end of Feb). The staff were always welcoming and more than helpful with any request. Loved the complimentary warm apple juice in the lobby of an evening, great way to warm up if you like that kind of thing. Good location, walking distance to Rodeo drive and a grocery store on Pico Blv and we caught the #7 bus to Santa Monica and back for $1 each, each way, easy! We also went across the road on Pico Blv to Brooklyn Pasta and Pizza- quality ingredients, eat in itâ€™s a cute shop with memorabilia on the walls, they also deliver http://brooklynpizzaandpasta.net/menu.html We also booked online a day tour with www.ADayinLATours.com Highly recommended if your time is limited and you want to see all the sights.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Efficient”
Reviews.Author: PeterBlades
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights staying at this hotel. The beds are very comfortable. Rooms are clean. The best part of this hotel are the staff, they are very efficient. Dennis on the front desk is certainly the best, he goes the extra mile an was very patient in directing me to the nearest hair dresser, Deli and shopping centre. The biggest shame for me was the gym, the seat on the exercise bike was broken and you couldn't adjust it. They have the space to add more resistance weights....

Reviews.Title: “Good price great location, Rodeo drive close by.”
Reviews.Author: IReviewer
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night prior to a cruise. After a long flight we enjoyed the welcome received here, the staff here were so pleasant and helpful. Everyone we came in contact with made our short stay extremely enjoyable. We walked the 15 minutes to Rodeo drive and visited all the shops in a matter of a few hours prior to heading to Long Beach.

Reviews.Title: “Top Class Hotel, top class staff”
Reviews.Author: JackieHx
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights after a cruise. From the minute we arrived on the forcourt we met nothing but helpful, smiling efficient staff. The concierge staff gave us advice where to stroll, where to eat and what tours to take. The room was superb, unfortunately a disturbance in the corridor at 3am, and a family room next door who were up and about at 6am, caused us to ask for another room. the 11th floor room was perfect, quiet and had views all the way to the Hollywood Hills. We went out for the day and all our possessions were moved for us by the staff. We received an apolgy (not the hotels fault at all) and given a complimentary breakfast. Riley Woods was very helpful and made sure every time he saw us that all was OK. The complimentary hot mulled cider in reception was to die for! We ate in the hotel bistro the first night but the 2nd night found thsat that bar served takeaway sandwiches and chips- not advertised, but very good value. When it was time to leave, the hotel booked us a car for $50 to LAX and a stretch limo turned up just for us at no extra charge. A fantastic finale to a trip to a first trip toAmerica

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Hotel, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: 3ecrm
Reviews.Content: Stayed there since the convention hotel nearby was sold out. Comparing to the outrageous price charged at the convention hotel, this is relatively good value in such a downtown area. The hotel is close to shops, restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “A real peep into the varied people of LA!”
Reviews.Author: Lolalondon_12
Reviews.Content: We began with a negative experience at breakfast but this was resolved, the staff need to realise that many of their clients have travelled long journeys and a warm smile and a kind word can make a big difference. Riley Woods at the front desk was very helpful always as well as Deming and Santos who served us breakfast and the Restaurant manager Dennis Kudos to him. he came every day to make sure we were suitably served. The hotel was in need of a renovation we expected more for such a high price of services. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Staff member Kenny - Two thumbs up!!”
Reviews.Author: Anthony M
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed recently at the Crowne Plaza Beverly Hills hotel. Greeted with great service, we were welcomed to a warm and fun loving hotel. A big thankyou and applause must go to staff member Kenny who ensured our transportation was booked and complete, putting us at ease with our travels. Kenny also provided me with his fantastic travel knowledge that would assist us throughout our travelling throughout the United States. Hat off to you Kenny, your friendliness and excellent customer service was greatly appreciated, a big thankyou!!

Reviews.Title: “Ordinary yet acceptable”
Reviews.Author: minnekid
Reviews.Content: Spent Friday and Saturday night with my wife while visiting family that lives close by. Friendly staff at check-in, I had mentioned the higher the floor the better and he accomodated us. We had booked on Priceline which can sometimes get you a cold shoulder but that wasn't the case here at all. The lobby was nice, self park was very conveniently located and at 17.00 was reasonable for the area. The rooms were clean and beds were comfortable, but there was just an outdated feel for the space. Bathrooms were small. Location is good for what I needed it to be. If you're going to LA you need to decide where your best location will be because 9 times out of 10 you're going to be driving somewhere during your stay so central location will be your own decision. This neighborhood is nice. All in all a pleasurable stay, it just seemd a little bit lacking for the money. I guess the good thing is you can count on a soild stay with no bad surprises.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Value in a HIGH $ Market”
Reviews.Author: R&G-Opine
Reviews.Content: The Crowne Plaza Beverly Hills is a very value in Los Angeles. I do over 100 nights a year in hotels, and I know Los Angeles very well. It is hard to beat the Crowne Plaza location, quality and service for an equal rate at other hotels in the area. In fact, many lower star / quality hotels in West Hollywood / Beverly Hills area command a premium price over this Crowne Plaza because they are closer to Hollywood or tourist sites. Don't be put off by the extra 2 miles you'll have to drive or cab from this location.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Denise F
Reviews.Content: The Crowne Plaza was an excellent experience for our family. In particular the friendly staff and great hospitality. My child had left something behind at the hotel that was of sentimental value and Davanie of concierge went out of her way to return this item to me. Her professional attitude and excellent customer service, together with a "can do" attitude was definately a stand out. We hope we can have the opportunity to return to this lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT SERVICE WITH A SMILE”
Reviews.Author: lillypilly72
Reviews.Content: This property excels in it's customer service, we arrived at the hotel at 8 am after our flight from Australia, we were allowed to check in immediately, no need to store our bags until 3pm check in time. The service from Dennis at front desk was fantastic, he offered us 2 drink vouchers for the bar straight away and said if there was anything else we need feel free to ask, our bags were also taken to our room promptly. The rooms themselves are a little old but very comfortable with a very nice bed and nice big plasma tv. The bathrooms were alittle small but more than adequate. We dined at the restaurant, what a fantastic meal and all at a reasonable price, but even better the service was exceptional, We needed advice as to the sights of Los Angeles, then we met Tatiana the concierge, i have never dealt with a more friendly, helpful and informative concierge ever, she is a true superstar and made our trip worthwhile, she is a assett to the hotel. Overall brilliant service with a smile and will definately be returning in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Kenny You Rock”
Reviews.Author: Wayne B
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure what some people expect from a hotel but from some of the comments far too much. The only negative was the bathroom is a bit too small and the door too close to the bed. That said it was clean, comfortable beds & pillows while the staff were amazingly helpful & enthusiastic. My wife, daughter & self were lucky to have had our luggage taken up to our room by "Kenny." He asked if we had stayed before & had we any plans. Then he drew the blinds & proceeded to point out, supermarket for food. Tell us where and best ways for buses for shopping, Santa Monica, walk to Rodeo drive and much more. All his tips were gold. Good location for all places, short cab into Hollywood, buses to Santa Monica & shopping at Beverley Central (another good tip from Kenny) Thanks to all as this was our last hotel after 5 weeks in the USA from Australia. 10/10 to the staff 12/10 for Kenny.

Reviews.Title: “"Stayed again this visit 2011"”
Reviews.Author: Melleasa
Reviews.Content: Hi visited Los Angeles again last year,September 12th stayed again at Crowne Plaza due to the fact as staying previously at Crowne Plaza am now familar with the area,so decided to stay again at the same hotel.Have to admit l think it is very very expensive staying there but it is a good hotel,so am planning to go back to Los Angeles next year 2013 with my children and as l am so used to the area we are planning to stay there again! They are friendly and do their best to assist you with anything that you may need help with so yes l do have to admit it is worth the money!!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been better!”
Reviews.Author: Lausie25
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Crowne Plaza at Beverly Hills for 5 days at the end of January 2012. It was my first time traveling anywhere, ever and I was by myself. When the staff member at the front desk heard this, he upgraded me to a king executive room on the top floor with compliementary breakfast everyday I was there! I think his name was Denis, he was so friendly and very helpful, an asset to the hotel. The room itself was pretty good, the bed and pillows were great, very comfortable. The only minor downside was the occupied adjoining room, I could hear them and I'm sure they could hear me. No big bother though as they weren't very noisy anyway. Bathroom was standard. Great big screen tv's. Concierge was very helpful and friendly, booked a hop on/hop off tour through Darryl which was great. Hotel seems to be full of aussie's which is good as I had people to talk to. Overall I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone! It couldn't have been a better experience! Overall would definitely recommend this hotel to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “average hotel”
Reviews.Author: pazzags
Reviews.Content: Overall a bit of a let down. Pretty average room and a very long walk to anywhere. Rodeo Drive approximately 45min walk at normal speed. Non of other attractions nearer than a cab ride away. Infact it was cheaper to hire a car for the day to get to universal studio's. No way could anyone walk to Hollywood Boulevard or Sunset Strip. My advice is get an hotel nearer the top end of town.

Reviews.Title: “Very good service, and value, good handicap room solutions”
Reviews.Author: Gil T
Reviews.Content: Stayed for couple of nights during weekend during a business tour. Service for very good and staff was pleasent and welcoming - way above average. Also they were very efficient at solving problems I had with my reservation (or lack of as I found out when I arrived). Convinient parking, 16 USD boufet large breakfast is valuable. Well equipped modern fitness room. I incidently received a handicap room (which is what they could offer me due to lack of reservation) but I can therefore say that this room is realy well suited for people with disabilities.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Average service and rooms”
Reviews.Author: Geoff S
Reviews.Content: This place is walkable (though a big walk) to most of the big Beverley Hills attractions. Nothing really wrong with the place, though we had a pretty average experience. We booked a non smoking room with 2 double beds for the four of us Our room reeked of smoke and the beds were only king singles. They changed our room to a non smoker with no apologies. They recoded Room key tags so that they didn't work. Quickly fixed, though again no apology. We had only towels and glasses etc for two, although we had booked and paid for 4. Again they fixed it, no comment. Red stains on sheets also a little off-putting.

Reviews.Title: “would stay again”
Reviews.Author: katiebear_85
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the crowne plaza for four nights in may 2011, I found the staff friendly and very helpful, especially the bell boy, who helped me when there was a bit of confusion with my hotel pick-up from a tour bus company who had a name nearly identical to another company, also arriving at the hotel at the same time, thanks to him i got on the right bus. Travelling solo, i was a little nervous leaving the hotel to find somewhere to eat on the first two nights, so i ordered room service and was delighted with how quick the waiter was to knock on my door with my food, which smelt amazing and tasted just as good. lots of places to eat along pico blvd and a supermarket about 5 min walk away. Location wasn't too bad, about a 15 min walk to rodeo drive, reception gave me a very basic map (only just had major roads) of how to get there, very easy, and there was a bus stop right out the front of the hotel. my last day there i ended up going on a horseback ride up towards to hollywood sign, which took much longer then i'd planned, so i called the hotel to tell them i would be late back to check out and was expecting to be charged extra because of this, but was told not to rush, and that they would see me when i got back, which definately took the stress off. bed was very comfy, and room quite spacious compared to other hotels i stayed at for the rest of my 6 week holiday, would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Average on all levels.”
Reviews.Author: PandSMadison
Reviews.Content: Really not a great location ... you could do much better. Staff were fine but nothing special in terms of service anywhere. Tour desk was useful. Rooms were ok ... seemed weird not to have movies when youa re in Beverly Hills though! Breakfast was ok. Bar staff and valet were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Best Host ever = Chantel”
Reviews.Author: bombadilio
Reviews.Content: I was staying at this hotel and had a "slight issue" on a previous visit. Walking in I was immediately taken away by how hospitable, welcoming, friendly Chantel was. I may be spelling her name wrong but you can't miss her, perfect hair and smile to match. She made my friend and I immediate at ease and did everything she could to make sure we had the most perfect weekend in years. I cannot thank her enough and the rest of the hotel staff for doing a SUPERB job. It is rare that I find such excellent service from anyone ( I am in the private event industry). It was better than walking into the Waldorf Astoria in NYC or the Carlton Hotel during the Cannes film festival. Thanks again to the whole Hotel Staff for doing a phenomenal job last weekend on the 13th!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing for the price”
Reviews.Author: jacinta1978
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Crowne Plaza for 4 days. The first problem we encountered was the concierge. We waited for approx 30 minutes to speak to her and then we were told 10 minutes into the conversation that she would need to speak to the next person and we could come back later (at this time it was 7pm) or come the next day. We ended up booking our own activities over the internet because every time we went down to speak to her there was a line up to speak to the concierge. The next problem we encountered was the unhelpful office staff. One of the members of the group asked if they could post a postcard back to Australia. They responded, quiet rudely, that no they couldn't. Only after she asked were she could find a stamp and a post office did they give a response. They told her to go to the office depot around the corner to get a stamp. We went there and they only sold stamps in packs of 100. We ended up asking the helpful bellboys and they pointed us in the direction of the service station, who were extremely helpful and gave us directions to the post office. We also wanted to go out for dinner to the cheesecake factory. The male concierge booked us into the restaurant which was good and then offered us a limo for $50. Lucky we decided to catch 2 taxis which came to a total of $6.00 per taxi each way. The other major problem we had was there was no safe in the room. The hotel offered safe deposit boxes to use and be stored in the front office. The deposit boxes were only big enough of items the size of passports. In this day and age majority of people would travel with items like laptops, ipads, ipod, etc - like we did. The office staff offered to store these items in the back office - but as the hotel states 'they take no responsibility for lost or stolen items so why would I leave it in an office.' This was the only hotel out of the 5 we stayed in in the US that didn't have inroom safes. This is something that should be fixed. On a good note the bell boys were extremely helpful - when our van didn't turn up they organised another mode of transport for us. The breakfast buffet was great and reasonably priced and the food and beverage staff were always extremely friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “The best concierge ever!”
Reviews.Author: Vecky D
Reviews.Content: What to say! Tatiana Zholanova, the concierge at the Crowne Plaza Bevery Hills was excellent! She helped us lot, saved our money and embellish our trip - she was really friendly but very professional and kind.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: Yorke M
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel mid morning after a 13 hour flight from Australia and the gentleman was able to check us early which was really appreciated. The room was very comfortable and had everything we needed during our stay. All the staff we dealt with were extremely helpful. Thoroughly enjoyed our stay and we would have no hesitation in recommending the hotel to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Stay”
Reviews.Author: W M
Reviews.Content: My stay started off well enough, the check in was near perfect. When I went up to my room I found that the lock on the door was broken. It took me literally 15-20 tries to get the key to work. The whole door knob seemed to be shaking and not allowing me to enter the room. When I finally got in the room I called to the front desk and they sent a maintenance technician right away. The second day I came back and went to park in the parking garage. The attendant was incredibly rude. She was very short and condescending. I then went to the front desk to complain about the parking attendant. I was met by the Assistant Front Desk Manager who told me that the parking attendant was part of the hotel staff, but not really. So he was sorry, but he emphasized that the parking attendants were part of a contract and not managed by the hotel... I t hen informed him that I was going to stay for an additional five nights, but not anymore because of that parking attendant. When I got up to my room I knew that I was making the correct choice because when I saw my bedding I found a few stains on them. I called the front desk and told them about the issue and they said they would send someone up to change the bedding. I went to dinner and when I came back I found two green scratchy blankets haphazardly tossed on the bed. The only good thing about this hotel is the spa, oh and the valet, but that is over priced.

Reviews.Title: “Tough Reviewer, Great Location, Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: trickydickfromoz
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights with a hire car. they have onsite parking available with access to cheaper valet parking or self parking via their hotel rewards program. Rooms were clean with fridge and microwave provided. no laundry rooms however there was a laundry 5 minute walk around the corner. Free WiFi in room. The beds were comfortable staff were helpful and friendly. The Hotel has a pool and jacuzzi onsite. Overall a very good experience. We would recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great base excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: chhall
Reviews.Content: Stayed with family, staff all very friendly and helpful, clean rooms but very small bathrooms. Great amenities, fridge/microwave in room, gym. Bar a bit pricey for food but great service.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and good location!”
Reviews.Author: as_1978
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights and whilst I agree that it is not a luxurious beverly hills hotel it is definitely clean and value for money in comparison to other hotels in the area! We have stayed at the Beverly Hilton in the past which is more luxurious but would definitely return here for value for money in the area! Rooms were clean and comfortable and we found the location fine for gettin around town.

Reviews.Title: “I enjoyed my one night”
Reviews.Author: Aussie_AAustralia
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my one night stay at the crowne plaza, room was lovely and clean, bed was nice and comfortable and they staff were very helpful and as I am a young female traveler who at the time was traveling on my own I felt very safe at the crowne plaza. I ordered room service and it was delicious just what I needed after 24 hours of traveling in several planes to arrive in the USA. Only thing was during the night I was awoken by banging on the roof above me and at 4am it sounded like a helicopter had taken off in my room it was the heater/cooler system boosting up or something. but the free Internet was excellent and it allowed me to stay in contact with my family definitely a plus! And also the free hot apple cider was delicious!

Reviews.Title: “Solid Choice”
Reviews.Author: CanadianTraveller883
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my son for a few days, prior to heading to Anaheim. Rooms were clean, location was very convenient considering the spots we wanted to visit. As a lot of other people pointed out the staff was friendly. One complaint, my son loves the Nickelodeon Channel, and they didn't have it. Their access to kid's tv was a little bit lacking, but its not a major point, after all we were there for vacation. Also an indoor pool would be nice, its not always ideal weather in L.A for an outdoor facility.

Reviews.Title: “Happy New 2012 Year from Moscow!”
Reviews.Author: AleksDeputat
Reviews.Content: Our visit to LA was short and there wasn't much time for any sightseeing. We came across a very professional Concierge Tatiana Zhdanova and she provided us with all information and support we needed. For New Year corporate ball we needed the best tuxedos money can buy and without any knowledge of hot shopping spots and without car it would of been time consuming for us to achieve our goals. Tatiana had hired a driver who took us for a shopping spree. All he was offering wasn't very satisfying so we asked him to call our invaluable Concierge Tatiana. She immediately set up appointments with Neiman Marcus sales person and our hourly driver hire had started to bring results worse money spent. Everywhere we went someone was already expecting us and if not for Tatiana's help we would of left LA empty-handed. After many business meeting we were so exhausted that flight to Vegas wasn't an option. We asked Tatiana to hire a car with a driver. On site van wasn't to our liking so we asked Tatiana to look elsewhere for a better SUV. Guilty as charged of calling Tatiana while she had days off with all our requests. She did a great job! All of us will recommend her services to everybody! Tatiana is knowledgeable, quick, resourceful, professional and she cares about her guests even when she is off duty! Every 2 months we are visiting LA and after seeing Tatiana in action there is no doubts that we will book only Crowne Plaza. She is a true gem of this hotel and I wish my Moscow crew was as devoted to their duties as she is. Best of luck in a New 2012 Year to Tatiana and we are looking forward to see her soon! Best egards, AleksD

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: Mano09
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel to stay in! Rooms were perfect staff were very helpful especially the concierge tatiana we would have had a very boring stay if it wasnt for her!

Reviews.Title: “Concierge”
Reviews.Author: Maria P
Reviews.Content: We would like to say thank you to Tatiana the concierge at the hotel for her fantastic assistance on our first day in Los Angeles. She was so helpful in all our requests and took her time with us so we didn't feel rushed into making quick decisions. Thank you Tatiana, very impressive.

Reviews.Title: “Had a good stay, would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Caitlin M
Reviews.Content: Gave it three stars for the great service, rooms were adequate - has a coffee machine, good tv channels, clean, good sized rooms. The only problem was a good 10 mins walk to restaurants. The restaurants in the lobby is no good. Noise from other rooms is quite loud. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Vampiregirl22
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Crowne Plaza for 3 weeks. During my stay I had a great time. The staff was really friendly and the food was delightful. I would go back there in the future again. I would suggest this hotel to everyone. It's the best.

Reviews.Title: “Staff is extremely friendly and helpful.”
Reviews.Author: Val M
Reviews.Content: This was my first time to Los Angeles. I did have a very limited time to do research by myself on where to go and what to see, so I used help from hotel concierge. From the very beginning, Tatiana comes across as a very professional and courteous person. Tatiana is extremely friendly and helpful. She made me perfect plan for all my everyday activities. She always expressed her personal ideas on which options may be better, it was done tastefully, and I did not feel pressured to choose "her option". I highly recommend this concierge for any LA related travel assistance.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Helen162
Reviews.Content: We have nothing but good things to say about our stay at this hotel. The staff were friendly and very helpful. The rooms were clean and comfortable. We arrived very late on the first night and the restaurant was closing but an extremely nice staff member who was working in the lounge bar said we could still order food. The meal was delicious and the bar server couldn't have been nicer. We would stay at the hotel again without a doubt. I was also in a convenient area, close to transport, shops and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Did the job”
Reviews.Author: CE-CMtrip
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights and didn't pay as it was part of a package deal. The location is good, it's a 15 minute walk to Rodeo Drive. The heater was very loud. The room was clean and beds were comfortable. Not sure I would choose to stay here again but it was fine for a short stay. We found it was quite noisy and we could easily hear people in other rooms and guests talking in the hallways. We were staying on a smoking floor and the smell was revolting (we are non-smokers).

Reviews.Title: “Average to say the least.”
Reviews.Author: Burgo_11
Reviews.Content: As part of my employment, I frequently travel internationally. On the world scale I would consider the Crowne as only average. The rooms are very dated but clean, and although host a nice tv, the luxury stops there. On arrival the rooms fridge still contained open food containers from the previous tenants. No room safe for your valuables except for one at reception. The aircon is not a split system and hence every 30mins your sleep is interrupted by the 'cummins deisel' compressor as it kicks in to cool the room. I know for a fact that there were 68 people staying along with us as I heard everyone of them flush the toilet and have showers from 3am onwards. The plumbing is not a high point. No microwave and a 'kettle' that only does one cup at a time makes picking up some light meals (to keep meal costs down) at the local 7/11, impossible. Internet, while available, was the slowest I have experienced in the US... All these points trival? possibly, but this is Beverley Hills after all.. suffice to say it qualifies for the 3 star rating as widely claimed. It seems Flight Centre are on a 'kick back' as almost every person there was from Aussie and had booked thru Flight Centre. One would / could assume anything "Hollywood" on the holiday plan gets the Crowne ticket by default. Further to my disappointment, I asked to extend the check out from lunchtime (12pm) to 6pm due to our late flight departure and was billed another $138 for an extra 6 hrs!!! While i didnt expect it for free, I was mildly shocked at the amount... Not to mention the 5:55pm phone call to see if we needed help getting downstairs. On the upside, House keeping was good (expect for our bonus in the fridge) with fresh beds/towels each morning. Staff at the desk where friendly and gave precise directions to the popular haunts. The 'help desk' in the foyer was handy and informative re any questions on getting from A to B. Beware the stitch up for their 'cheaper than a taxi personal cars' as transport. Get a bus schedule and use the Metro. Bus to Hollywood only costs $1.50 per person... ensure you ask for a "link ticket". Then your good for 2 bus rides. Bus routes criss cross LA and are easy to decypher. Very safe and bus drivers friendly. 45mins to Walk of fame. 1hr to Venice beach. Phone the LA metro for full, very easy directions on buses and times. They open at 6am. Google "LA bus metro" for contact nos. Sorry about the burst of automatic fire Crowne, but I just didnt feel 'special' at your hotel this week and have had warmer stays at Super 8s in the midwest.

Reviews.Title: “Would return”
Reviews.Author: messiswife
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 10 days, overall happy with hotel. Staff were friendly and rooms were kept clean and food was good. Hotel in a good location, not far from rodeo drive

Reviews.Title: “can't complain”
Reviews.Author: Sydneyskye
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not brand new however the rooms are very clean and quite spacious. The staff are excellent and they have a bar there when you can get a drink and take it out to the swimming pool. It is about 15 minute walk to Rodeo Drive which is fine and there are shops along the way you can look at. There are nearby restaurants to chose from a very good Thai one about 5 minute walk from the hotel. We have stayed here previously and will continue to because it is very good value, love a swimming pool and the bar area is good.

Reviews.Title: “Will not return”
Reviews.Author: valentinanat
Reviews.Content: I echo the same sentiments that another reviewer wrote: "Although the hotel is called Crowne Plaza Beverly Hills, it is not located in ...Beverly Hills at all...The service from the front desk was very helpful." We got a king bed suite on the 8th floor which has a pull-out sofa bed for an extra person or two, and there is a kitchenette with microwave. It is spacious, but as soon as you walk into the bedroom and the closet, there is an mistakable smell of sweat? something old and moldy. The bathroom sink is clogged which I mentioned to the front desk when checking out. The room is odd numbered and on the street side of the hotel and you can hear quite a bit from car traffic to garbage truck pick up. We only stayed one night, but because of noise plus the smell, we will not return there.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the location”
Reviews.Author: kjzrsz
Reviews.Content: The staff at the hotel are very pleasant and obliging. It is not exactly "Beverly Hills", but very close and convenient with a car. The rooms could use some updating but are clean. We have stayed on the executive floor which comes with breakfast. The breakfast is great and I would recommend this option. We visit family in the neighborhood and the access is great for us with easy in and out of the parking garage.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite located in Beverly Hills”
Reviews.Author: My_Travel_Book
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel is called Crowne Plaza Beverly Hills, it is not located in the center of Beverly Hills at all. It is located at the far-end of Beverly Hills. The room is a little small but clean. The service from the front desk was very helpful. Can't compare it with other 4 or 5 star hotel because it is not. Just because it's on Beverly Drive doesn't mean it's a prestigious hotel. Would recommend staying at a cheaper hotel not on Beverly Drive. Aside from this, the good part of the hotel is that it's not located in the jam-packed areas of Beverly Hills.

Reviews.Title: “Get what u pay for... Dated, but clean, tidy, safe... Staff lovely...”
Reviews.Author: MWTuff
Reviews.Content: Look, it's getting on but for the price it was good... Location was walkable for us to get around, staff were very helpful.... Room clean and tidy.... Don't expect the Regent Beverly Wilshire.... Would stay again, lots of locals (Aussies) there...

Reviews.Title: “Hotel out from town”
Reviews.Author: Nerak58
Reviews.Content: We arrived 3 hours early and thankfully once again we waited only 10 minutes and the room was ready, overlooking the pool which is nice. Standard king room however the bathroom is very pokey. There is a fridge,yes!,but no in room safe which seems to be fairly standard across USA even in cheaper establishments. Tea and coffee in room too. A small kiosk in the lobby allows for you to buy real milk, magazines and savories etc. Enjoyed a drink at the bar a couple of times...has a nice atmosphere and the wifi works well here so can catch up on my reviews. Buffet breakfast $16 usual fare and no cheese on the eggs, hallelujah! Would have preferred a hotel closer to the action had we booked ourselves and not through travel agent but this is no fault of the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Charlotte S
Reviews.Content: On arriving at the hotel we were greeted by very friendly and helpful staff. The person at the front desk immediately offered us the chance to join their priority club, which entitled us to cheaper parking and a room with a better view. The fact that to join the priority club is free was an much appreciated added bonus. The room was fantastic, the beds were amazingly comfortable, lots of space and a great view over down-town L.A. The hotel was in a great location to visit rodeo drive, Hollywood and even Santa Monica beach. The concierge was really helpful and even booked us a reservation in a restaurant. I can't fault this hotel at all and would recommend it to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Need a 3.5 option!”
Reviews.Author: jaxf1
Reviews.Content: This was our first port of call on a honeymoon to NZ and it did everything we needed it to. We arrived in the evening, found it easily and fairly quickly from the airport and wandered round the corner (5 mins) to grab a bite to eat. Next day, we walked the 25 mins or so into Beverley Hills and took a quick tour around. The hotel is fine for getting about - us Europeans will love the long walks to get to places, others may prefer to get a cab!! The room in the hotel was the least satisfactory part of the experience... it wasnt bad but the noise from the AC and the door which led to the adjoining room was a bit rubbish. But we literally just fell into the comfy bed after our long flight so it wasnt too much of an issue. The highlight of this hotel - the staff. The concierge was fantastic, so helpful. The door staff and particularly our driver who took us back to the hotel - absolutely superb. Easy to talk to, informative and a great laugh. I would recommend this hotel for the location and the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Fab places to stay, take a breather from the busy city of LA!”
Reviews.Author: Emi J
Reviews.Content: Awesome hotel and great value. My parents and i did a fly drive round california and after 11 hours on a plane it was just nice to spread out and enjoy the queen sized beds! Local shop was just 5 mins away and an on site car parking. If i had a chance to go back to LA i would 100% go back to Crowne Plaza Hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel and great value”
Reviews.Author: josephinetraveler
Reviews.Content: I was very pleasantly surprised with our experience at this hotel. The staff, especially the bell desk and valet, were extremely nice, friendly and efficient. They always thought two steps ahead, for example making sure the car was ready up front before bringing us and the luggage down. The room was quiet, perfectly clean and fresh, good size with very comfortable beds and nice linens. Decor was contemporary and simple yet warm. Room service was good with good food and timely service. Nice large flatscreen TV with premium channels, however no pay-per-view movies, which would be my comment for improvement. Overall, I thought this hotel delivered very good value and location for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Crowne Plaza Beverly Hills”
Reviews.Author: lu123442
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed 6 nights in Sep 2011 and we were happy with our stay there. Crowne Plaza is located in a quiet area of Beverly Hills with a Pavillions supermarket only a 5-10 min walk and shops and restaurants 15-20 mins walk. Our room had 2 double beds with plenty of room to move around and the beds were VERY comfortable. We had a large flat screen TV as well as a small fridge (which we soon discovered was not very common in US hotels). One gripe I have is that I discovered a rather large stain on my bedsheet on my first night which housekeeping changed the following day. Other than that, our stay was very pleasant. The front desk staff were very friendly and Kenny at Concierge was very helpful with booking our sightseeing tours and transportation needs. There are 2 computers in the Business Centre however only 1 computer was working during my stay there. Overall I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great friendly service”
Reviews.Author: Keentravelle
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the crowne plaza Beverley hills for 5 nights and were very happy with our stay there. Don't always believe the bad reviews it was not like the reviews I read before we booked. The staff were so helpful and friendly and should be commended on that! It is no trouble for them to even tell you the buses to catch... Close to rodeo dr a very short walk in fact. Buses run from around the corner to all the major sites to see. The rooms were great too. Bed huge and comfortable. Yes the bathrooms may be a bit outdated but seriously who spends that much time in there? Even the cleaning staff greeted you daily! The gym is also great with fantastic equipment. My only advice would be to double check you get nonsmoking at the desk before you go to your room because even though we'd booked this ours was not and we ended up with smoking and I thought too late to change once unpacked?? I'm an avid nonsmoker so we had to air the room out daily! But overall a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Good without Spectacular”
Reviews.Author: HonBar
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my wife at the hotel for 3 nights in June this year. We generally liked the hotel, subject to a few comments. It is comfortable but a bit dated and I agree with comments of the previous review about the noisy air-conditioning. In June the nights were cool so we switched it off and opened the window so it was not a big issue. The breakfast menu was limited, unless you like your cereal sugar coated (I don't). It is a fair walk to the shops on Rodeo Drive and Beverly Road, but that was fine with us as we like to walk (although I gather that is a bit of rarity in LA). There are some good restaurants nearby. We liked South Beverly Grill on 122 S Beverly Dr (10 mins walk).

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel & Noisy Room”
Reviews.Author: Cbehan
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here for two nights of a two week honeymoon in America and it was our least favourite because of the noise in our room i.e. the air conditioning was something like we never heard before, the fridge also made some strange noises every half hour, there was a bedroom adjacent with a door separating and could hear occupants every move not two mention the foot steps from the room above on our ceiling. The bathroom was very small but bedroom was a good size. On the positive side the room was clean and doorman helpful and friendily, there are some nice restaurants within walking distance, fast and free internet access but I am afraid the noise just ruined our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel IN California”
Reviews.Author: conboy
Reviews.Content: I recently visited 6 locations in California and stayed in 5 beautiful hotels. The 6th Hotel the Crowne Plaza on South Beverly Drive in Beverly Hills was absolutely awful. The staff were cold and unfriendly, the decor was straight out of the 1970s and the stale smell from the same era. The bedroom was small and the bathroom more like a small closet. There was no safe in the bedroom and the AC unit sounded like a jet engine there was no way you could sleep with it on. There were people buying gold and silver in a bedroom at the end of the corridor which added to the sleazy feel of the place. There was a charge of $25 per day to use the car park. If you are considering going to Beverly Hills please give this hotel a miss you will not be nissing anything.

Reviews.Title: “happy 40th”
Reviews.Author: digirolz
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights Sept 2011. The bed was very comfy and the location was great, walking distance from Rodeo Drive. Metro bus stop to Downtown LA at the front door. Staff were very friendly and keen to offer local knowledge.

Reviews.Title: “Small bath room”
Reviews.Author: johnenriadekock
Reviews.Content: We visited this hotel for since more than 5 years. Excellent beds. Bathroom too small: remove the bath and replace by shower only. The pool was heated but the beds at the pool are weared out. We visited the hotel 2 times in 2 weeks and experiated 2 different approaches as a Platinum Member. The first time no bottle ofnwater, no welcome drinks and too high parking fee. The second we were welcomed with water and welcome drinks and lower parking fee. There is a Ralph's supermarket nearby.

Reviews.Title: “not worth the money!”
Reviews.Author: ads11
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in september 2011 in this hotel. we were on a 2,5 week holiday on the westcoast, and this hotel was not the best we stayed in. and yes breakfast is okay and location is good. but carpet in the room is dirty and bathroom is not good! Hotel needs an urgent renovation! more than USD 200,00 for a room is very overpriced. Adrian from the netherlands

Reviews.Title: “Felt like a million dollars!!”
Reviews.Author: DanceWorld
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for the last week of a three week trip to America earlier this year and it was fabulous. From the moment we arrived, the staff greeted us so warmly and looked after us straight away. The reception area is gorgeous and the hotel has lots of facilities. Our room was gorgeous, there was only two of us in the room and we had a huge bed each (king size). The room was so spacious and was overlooking the Hollywood Hills. No question or query was too much hassle for the staff. We asked for a car one of the mornings to take us on a trip and it was there within five minutes. Everything about our stay here was perfect and we would definitely recommend it to anybody looking to stay in the Beverly Hills region.

Reviews.Title: “THANKS TATIANA”
Reviews.Author: LYNNETTE S
Reviews.Content: Tatiana, the Concierge was incredibly helpful in assisting us with some complicated luggage arrangements. She was funny, caring and appeared to genuinely love her job. She made our stay very pleasurable. The hotel was lovely - beautiful rooms in a gorgeous location within walking distance of Rodeo Drive.

Reviews.Title: “Good overall stay, some let downs, no deal breakers”
Reviews.Author: Judge404
Reviews.Content: An oldish hotel, the Crowne Plaza has recently been given a facelift - which shows. Fittings and trim is new but the building shows its age. Omissions in the upgrade include the lack of safes in rooms. This facility is available via lock boxes at reception, but this is a pain to use after a while. Location is OK, 20 minute walk to Rodeo Drive and a main bus route passes by the hotel. Avoid rooms near the elevator as hotel management has placed soft drink vending machines at these points and they make OUTRAGEOUS amounts of noise. We asked to have our room exchanged for one further away. If you intend to spend a lot of time in your room or at the hotel, then look elsewhere. If you're out and about and need a place to crash - this serves the purpose.

Reviews.Title: “Older style hotel on edge of Beverly Hills offering great service.”
Reviews.Author: Ozstars
Reviews.Content: We have just spent 5 nights here and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. While being on edge of Beverly Hills may be a disadvantage it is walkable distance to supermarket and CVS parmacy (5 mins uphill on W Pico Blvd) and coin laundry (5 mins walk left on W Pico Blvd), restaurants along S Beverly north (10 - 20 mins) - breakfast at Beverly Liz was fantastic or dinner at The Cheescake Factory. Bank with ATM next door and bus stop outside main entrance. Concierge services cater very well for tourists giving advice on tours, transport etc. We took the Starline Hop On Hop Off 48hr Double Decker Bus - be prepared to walk 30 mins at moderate pace to get to bus stop where it commences. Tour ok but commentary via pre-recorded voice was hard to hear most of the time. Work out bus and subway if you just want to go to Hollywood or Santa Monica and save the $. Concierge organized hotel transport to and from Universal - while costing $15 pp each way you got there straight away and didn't have to shuttle from hotel to hotel. The driver gave us a mini tour on way back of Hollywood homes with bit of humor which was a bonus. Highlight of stay was the fantastic service in the bar lounge from Luis and Jesus! We ate 3 nights out of the 5 as the food was so good, reasonably priced and finally had some veges! These guys welcomed us and other guests too like old friends every night, checked on how we were going and topping up our drinks with a bit of a chat. They are a real treasure for this hotel as they make everyone feel so welcome. Crowne Plaza is a great place to stay especially for us Aussies. We will leave with some very fond memories!! Thank you

Reviews.Title: “Maybe there are better options?”
Reviews.Author: Kim004
Reviews.Content: Had reservations on staying here after being recommended by the travel agent but then reading Tripadvisor. Next time - I am going with Tripadvisor reviews. This hotel is indeed in need of a major revamp - its old, past quaint.Whilst I agree it is all adequate - it really isn't worth the money. Everything and I mean everything is past acceptable - this hotel is verging on seedy - but it is clean and safe. Our room was also meant to be non smoking - hmmm. I also found the customer service staff to always be very busy elsewhere - its not the biggest hotel so why the queues for front of house service? The Concierge was the only person to provide tourist information and was never without customers waiting and waiting. There has to be better options for safe mid range accommodation in LA?

Reviews.Title: “Really Enjoyed our stay perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Shelley S
Reviews.Content: Stayed here August 2011 the hotel was very clean the pool area was very nice we had a very nice room over looking beverly drive. The location was perfect for getting around as other reviews have said the hotel rooms do need upgrading the bathrooms really need upgrading as are quite old, but are kept very clean. We used the chauffeur service which was at the side of the hotel they where excellant we went on a 7 hour tour with Augie he knew all the perfect location and also loads of knowlegde on California and George the manager was very helpful to. All in all the Crown plaza is a nice hotel staff where helpful and the beds are very comfortable as everybody says I would stay here again. Paradise cove in Malibu is totally awesome, Ruth steak house is awesome just on Beverly drive best steak ever.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I've ever stayed at - absolute shocker”
Reviews.Author: Louise_Ed
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights with our 2 year old son on a trip to LA. I can usually find something okay to say about a hotel, but this hotel was pretty bad. Firstly the hotel needs some major updating. The towels are old and stained, the shower curtain had what can only be described as a 'former guest's snot' on it, and the room had a grubby feel about it. On the second night our toilet overflowed. They sent someone to clean up the mess with a towel, and we had argue that they disinfect the floor. I found the staff to be quite rude in general. On one occassion we were almost bowled over by a staff member trying to get into the lift in front of us, leaving us to wait for the next one. To top it all off, on the last night there was an extremely loud Jewish band playing somewhere in the hotel. I'm not one to complain about a bit of noise, but this was beyond ridiculous. When we complained to the front desk they didn't really seem to care at all and did nothing about the noise. For some reason this hotel was full of Aussies like us. Not sure why but was nice all the same. One of the only good things about this hotel was the pool size and area. The location was reasonable but not that close to Rodeo Drive if you want to walk there. There is a Ralphs grocery store just a block away for some drinks and snacks. Parking is $22 a day on top of what is an already overpriced hotel for what you get. I stayed at Mr C just up the road which was modern, clean, and had fabulous service. I would recommend staying there instead of this cesspit!

Reviews.Title: “JUST A STANDARD USA TYPE CROWN PLAZA HOTEL WITH SMALL ROOMS AND BATHROOMS”
Reviews.Author: travelguy1944
Reviews.Content: ARRIVAL: Taxi from the airport to hotel approximately US$46 - all taxiâ€™s use a meter. CHECK IN: Ok, but donâ€™t expect any room upgrade no matter what level membership you have with Priority Club membership as it will not happen. You may have the club lounge included which will give you a continental breakfast. CLUB ROOM: There is a 24 hour Club Room on the 12th floor (this is the top floor) where a light breakfast is served - fruit, scrambled eggs, bacon, fried potato and bread plus tea/coffee. After breakfast is finished there is absolutely nothing available until breakfast the next day. So, not much point in keeping it open as there is nothing there. ROOMS: Very small rooms and even smaller bathroom. No room to move in the bathroom and the toilet bowl is about 8ft from your head when lying down on the bed. All rooms are the same size. This is just below a 3 star hotel and I donâ€™t now how it ever had approval to become a Crown Plaza property. There does not seem to be any consistency in relation to hotel gradings in the USA as many hotels are below the grading which is what you would expect from hotels in India. We paid $232 per night but I really don't think it was worth this much. INTERNET: WiFi internet available and works ok in the room as I had a room with the modem connected in my room. AIR CONDITIONING: Very noisy and the compressor kicks in and out and keeps you awake. About time they replaced these with a quieter more modern inverter system. RESTAURANTS: Quite a few restaurants within walking distance from the hotel. SHOPPING: Not much close to the hotel except the Westfield Mall which is about a 40 minute walk away. SUPERMARKET: Ralphs supermarket is just a 5 minute walk away and is just around the corner from the hotel. They sell just about everything including self serve salad bar and wine by the bottle at reasonable prices. TOURS: Hop on Hop off bus stops outside the Intercontinental Hotel which is about a 25 minute walk from the Crown Plaza hotel. Price for a 24 hour ticket is $35 and $50 for a 48 hour pass. This gives access to all 4 different tour sectors - brochure available from the concierge. You will need a ticket for 48 hours to include all 4 tour sectors. CONCIERGE: Excellent service from the concierge who helped up arrange a few tours.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: ash0902
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during the long weekend and I expected better service for the price. The front desk lady was rude and not very friendly and everyone behind the check in counter seemed to busy chit chatting amongst themselves rather than providing efficient services. The only good thing is if you're a member of the priority club then you get discounted parking and free water upon check in, and you get free house beers or wine with the membership. But be warned because they forget to mention that to you and if you order any drink other than the house then you'll have to pay for it. The room was decent size but not well lit, the bathroom was small and leaked. The water wouldn't drain in the bathtub until you were done with your shower. I don't think I'll be staying here ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: hannahlorimer
Reviews.Content: Hotel was great however didnt enjoy LA at all. Large spacious room with great breakfast everyday - lots of choice with pancakes, waffles, crispy bacon. All the standard American options. Location was okay. We were told that we could walk to the Beverley Wilshire as we were going there for dinner. We set off to only find quite quickly that it was a little way to go especially when your walking down a busy road in heels. The hotel saw how we were dressed and still sent us on our way. Being a family of three the hotel should really of just got us a taxi. In fairness we learnt quite quickly that nothing in Beverley Hills is really walking distance. Hotel taxis are cheap so we often just went with them. A trip around the celebrity hosues is fun when you are travelling with kids too!

Reviews.Title: “Australian Central!”
Reviews.Author: bluechilli8
Reviews.Content: Must be a very popular hotel for Australian Travel Agents because I felt like I was home with the amount of Australian accents I heard! Front desk staff were very efficient and helpful. Doormen were always courteous. Concierge was honest and helpful. A few hotels could learn a thing or two from the staff there. Room was very spacious and clean. The bathroom is a little narrow. Power point in bathroom wasn't working so I left a note for housekeeping in the morning and was pleasantly surprised to find it fixed and a apology for the inconvenience by the time I returned in the afternoon. I didn't notice any noise from the other rooms. The mini fridge was useful to store water and twinkies! Work desk and extra arm chair was nice to have. There was a vending machine and an ice machine on my level (level 3) Television had many channels and there was a cd player in the room too. There were 2 computers in the business centre which were always taken. Free wifi in room. Lobby also has a small convenience store with snacks, tshirts, magazines and drinks. You pay for the convenience but compared to convenience stores in Aus, the prices weren't too outrageous. Bus stop in front of the hotel takes you to Hollywood and downtown. Another bus stop around the corner to the left of the hotel takes you to Santa Monica. A small jewish supermarket around the corner is handy for a bottle of water or some fruit, A larger supermarket is on the corner of west olympic and south beverly. Wilshire and Rodeo drive are about a 20-30minute walk from the hotel. On the way there are a few cafes, restuarants and subway. Walking there on my own was a little daunting but I didn't feel unsafe. Starline tours pick up and drop off at this hotel. Lovely stay, I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Neverending assistance!”
Reviews.Author: sue d
Reviews.Content: I wanted to go to some shopping centers in Los Angeles and discussed this with Davanie Womack, one of the Concierge at Crowne Plaza. She gave us a detailed map and pointed out which ones were best to go to. Wanted to do some shopping for a particular item which was a lot cheaper in America than Australia. Needed to find a store who stocked my item. This was not easy. Davanie went out of her way by assisting me with not only finding names of stores, but calling the stores to see if they had what I wanted. Not a service you would expect from a hotel. She was fantastic. After going to these stores, I could not purchase the item as they were made out of wood and I could not take wood products back into Australia. Went to one of the stores at a shopping centre she had sent us to who could help me with my product, but it would have to be mailed to the hotel as they never had them in their stores. Only by internet. They said they would have it there before we left in 5 days. Well, it did not appear in the five days and when calling the company concerned, they advised me it was with their courier company and would be delivered the following day. Too late. Approached Davanie to thank her for all her troubles and asked her if she would like the product as it was not arriving until we had left the country. She then said that she understood how much this product meant to me and that when it arrived she would post it to me. I said it was not a small parcel and she said I will post it to you via sea mail. I then gave her my contact details. This was another service received by the Crowne Plaza hotel in Beverly Hills that is way beyond what one expects. All in all, a lovely hotel for staying at in Beverly Hills. Not far from anything. So much assistance from not only the Concierge, but the room staff and baggage assistants at the door. Greatly appreciated and if we do return to Beverly Hills we will not hesitate in where to stay. Thank you Crowne Plaza. Sue Davis

Reviews.Title: “OK, but needs some updating”
Reviews.Author: GwenSantaMonica
Reviews.Content: Front desk service was great and the hotel is centrally located, but it could be better. The bathrooms need updating, there is no soundproofing (you can hear conversations in neighboring rooms), the club room doesn't offer any snacks or drinks and the bathroom could have been cleaner. They gym was decent, though and they provide free wi-fi.

Reviews.Title: “Been there done that, do it again”
Reviews.Author: Libby023
Reviews.Content: Staff were very accommodating and helpful. Hotel was clean and tidy with an air of old world class. Private hire car arranged through this hotel arrived on time with a smile. and helped with information and luggage. Restaurant meals filling, tasty and presented elegantly.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Patty375
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay in this Hotel, the stuff was kind and helpful, the Room Service very punctual and our room was clean. Just a few minutes walk to the Rodeo Drive and Wilshire B. and near the Hotel is a bus stop, you can reach other places like Hollywood B. or Santa Monica Pier. There is also a Limousine service, we have benefited to reach the airport. We will recomand this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location.”
Reviews.Author: CaspianJVC
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a good location as it is not far from the airport, Hollywood, LA and Santa Monica. There is also Century City Shopping Centre 30 minute walk or a short cab or bus ride. The hotel although older is well looked after and the staff are very helpful. As some other people have said there is a little issue with noise coming from other rooms however we did not have this issue until the last night as i don't think there was anyone next to us previously. If you want to get to LA or the shopping centre you can take the 728 rapid or the 28 bus which are only 5 minutes walk away. From Century city you can take a bus to Hollywood or Santa Monica.

Reviews.Title: “Not As Glamourous As The NameSuggests”
Reviews.Author: MMMH
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights at the end of July. The name of this hotel suggests grandeur and luxury, forget it! It is a nice hotel, 3 star by European standards. Speedy check in, average room, spotlessly clean. The bar downstairs is a bit depressing, very dark and gloomy. This is where food is served too so we weren't tempted to stay there to eat. Breakfast is served in the restaurant but we didn't eat there either. The hotel concierge, we were dealing with Tatianya, is really well informed and very, very helpful. There is a bus outside the door which brings you to a stop for the hop-on-hop-off or too the Farmer's Market/The Grove shopping plaza. Los Angeles is such a sprawling city that taxis are expensive so you need to access public transport if possible and this hotel is well located for that. Would recommend this hotel because of it's location rather than because of hotel facilities.

Reviews.Title: “An average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Emmat93
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for three nights. This hotel was ok. The outside and lobby area were well kept and quite modern but the rooms felt very dated in comparison with the other hotels we stayed in during our trip. The room was clean and spacious with two double beds and a massive widescreen TV but the bathroom was tiny and very 70s looking. The hotel is also very far from the main places that we wanted to visit. For example, it took us 50 mins by bus to get to the Walk of Fame and 40 mins on the bus to get to Santa Monica. Also there are very few places to go around the hotel although check out Brooklyn Pizza on Pico Bld - very good pizzas and friendly staff. Also Factor's Deli is good for breakfast as the hotel breakfast is extremely overpriced. The man in the gas station across the street was very friendly too - go here for snacks as the hotel's shop is overpriced. All in all - a very average hotel - certainly not what I expected of Beverly Hills.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks from Russian tourists”
Reviews.Author: jozhik
Reviews.Content: We visited Los Angeles in July 2011. The sity made a great impression on us and 80% of it was due to the highly qualified concierge of the Crown Plaza hotel Tatiana Zhdanova. All our requests, problems and questions were met with outmost proficiency and care. We are lucky to have met such a highly qualified and caring manager. Alla Feldman, Kholodniakova Ekaterina

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, close to Rodeo Drive”
Reviews.Author: Boltstress
Reviews.Content: Met the standards that this chain and level require. Dinner was surprisingly good for hotel food, the welcome drinks we're nice and the staff helpful. Only about 1/2 a mile from Rodeo Drive, and very handy for Ventura Highway so a good location

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Blake'sMOM
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the Crown Plaza in July. Good location and great service and walking Distance to shopping and place to eat. I have stayed at many Crown Plaza Hotels but this was not near as nice as the tCrown Plaza hotels I have been too. Room was clean and beds good and a great big flatscreen TV which we loved! Pool was ok and food was ok . If I went back I would stay somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, nice room”
Reviews.Author: Bortam
Reviews.Content: Wanted a break from the hotel we were staying in, so walked in off the street and booked for 2 nights - we were lucky to get a room because they were full. When we got to our room the air conditioning was not working. The problem was rectified in minutes. The room was clean, the bed was comfortable. The front of house staff were excellent, the pool and spa were clean and enjoyable. The hotel is a little old and could probably do with some upgrading but overall it was pleasant and we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel at a good location”
Reviews.Author: ViennaMichael
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at Crowne Plaza Beverly Hills and we chose it again because of the conveniant location. Hotel: The hotel is an older property but very well maintained. South Beverly Drive is about 25 minutes ba car from the airport. From the hotel its a 15 minutes walk or 3 minutes drive to Rodeo Drive. On the street between Hotel and rodeo Drive there are several nice cafes and restaurants. The area is not one of the elegant parts of Beverly Hills but we alwaysd felt save. There is a nice pool (without pool bar) and Jacuzzi. The hotel bar and restaurant are very cosy and staff was always friendly. Rooms: Rooms are spacious and nice. The aircondition is working properly although the window units are a bit loud. Bathroom is OK, all amenities available. Staff: Hotelstaff including valet parking, reception and concierge were always nice and helpful. We will come back to this hotel when we come to Los Angeles, biggest plus is the good location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service”
Reviews.Author: Gmq71462
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff is extremely accommodating, especially Dennis Phillips.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our time here”
Reviews.Author: _LA_L0VE
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for 10 nights and this was our first stay in L.A. After arriving in the evening off a long journey from Edinburgh we found ourselves on the top floor (12th) and could not have been happier. The room and bed were large aswell as the huge tv! we noticed our toilet did not flush properly but after calling reception an engineer was sent up straight away (even at around 11pm) and this was fixed so we could relax knowing we didn't need to change rooms. We decided to use the bus instead of hiring a car, this was so easy as the number rapid 7 stops just round from the hotel and is $1 to get to Santa Monica beach where you can see all the sights and walk along to Venice.Also stopping right at the front of the hotel is the number 14 bus and for $1.50 we went got off at Beverly/Vermont,as it is right at the subway entrance. This is the best way to get up to Hollywood and also Universal Studios and for $6 you can get a metro underground day pass that also can be used on all the metro buses for that entire day. all of the buses and undergrounds stops are clearly visible and announced each time. We also found the bus drivers extremely helpful.The undergrounds have armed security that get on/off so be aware to keep your ticket handy as they check but its nice to make you feel safe.Hollywood was great for sight seeing and things to do,my advice is when you are approached about tours to see sights walk along the blvd waiting until you get the best deal as we ended up on a great tour for more than half the price of the rest just because we bargained a bit with ticket seller.The hotel was about 10 mins walk from rodeo drive where you could spend a fortune in 1 shop if you are that way inclined however the 14 bus stops at the Beverly center and the 7 stops at the Westside Pavillion both were great and much more our price range. The staff in the hotel were all friendly, however Dennis at reception was just brilliant, always happy to help and great at telling me how good universal studios was going to be. They have good hand drawn maps of the area and also keep your valuables in a safety deposit box which you have access to 24 hours.The concierge was always busy so we mainly had our own ideas about where to go. Housekeeping did a great job everyday and always had fresh towels in our room. The best place we ate was Saddle Ranch steak house on the sunset strip, great fun with a mechanical bull in the middle of the restaurant and huge candy floss desserts(given to us for free as it was my birthday). Nearer to the hotel I highly recommend Factors. Just round the corner and across the road it was our favorite place for breakfast, very clean and very homely. The hotel breakfast was also nice and for $16 you can have all you can eat.There is free wifi in the hotel which came in handy when we were planning our days or checking places to eat etc. We drank in the hotel bar a few times but it is very expensive so a better idea is to go to Ralphs supermarket just up from Factors and use the fridge in the room.The only disappointment we had was when we left. A shuttle bus had been booked for us by one of the bellman and ended up being late to collect us. When we finally got to LAX we had 20mins left to check in for our flight to London. This meant we were separated on the 10 hour trip back,luckily the stewardess resolved this on the plane but was an issue that should not have happened as we normally give ourselves plenty of time before flights. I would recommend anyone to stay at the Crowne Plaza and not to be put of by people saying you cant get around or the location is poor. Thankyou for having us and we will be back to L.A. as soon as we have saved up!

Reviews.Title: “Amazingly thin walls”
Reviews.Author: Xabbu
Reviews.Content: Several things about this hotel are not too good and make it a hotel I wouldn't stay at again. The walls are ridiculously thin and the noise from adjoining rooms sounds like the people would be in my room. They provide ear plugs, but since I don't like the feeling of them in my ears this didn't really help me sleep better. The location is OK, but not really in nice Beverly Hills. It might technically be still in the city of Beverly Hills, but it's right at the end of it (and not really at a nice end). The rooms are practical, but they would need a renovation. On the good side is the breakfast, which was pretty fairly priced and which had amazingly friendly waiters, who made the day start in a good way.

Reviews.Title: “Good 3.5 stars hotel. Will stay again next time”
Reviews.Author: Pasta0
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Beverly Hills Crowne Plaza for a total of 5 nights during June 2011. We have a pleasant stay. Please do not compare this hotel with other 4/5 stars hotel. This is a 3.5 stars hotel. We received very friendly check in services (Thanks Dennis !!) and we were put on the Club floor (top floor) and have breakfast included.
