Our plane arrived at LAX at 7am and we requested early check in beforehand (subject to availability) and we got the room early which was great as the last thing we want to do is to wait for 3pm check in after a 14 hours plane trip. The bedroom is reasonable size and our king bed was comfortable. We requested a rollaway bed for our child which is not as comfortable but it does its job. The hotel and hotel room has old decor and probably need some updates. The bathroom is quite small and require some renovations. The room comes with free Wi Fi access and a nice LCD TV. Breakfast was nice and Lucy from the breakfast room was very friendly and welcoming. We did not attempt to talk to the concierge which everyone rave about coz her desk is always occupied with guests and she talks so loudly that we can hear all the conversations. On the last day, our flight does not depart until 10pm, so we requested late check out and we pay $50 to stay till 6pm which was very reasonable. The hotel also have a small business room with 2 computers. There is also a printer so we used it to purchase theme park tickets on line which is very handy. The hotel is right opposite the Residence Inn and that's where Hertz car rental is. If you plan to pick up a car from Hertz , this is probably a good hotel to stay at so you can just walk across the road to pick up and drop off your car. The location of the hotel is ok although you will need a car if you plan to travel around LA. There is a bus near the hotel that takes you to Santa Monica though. We parked at the carpark and it cost us $15 per day (as we are priority club member) and we think that's reasonable. There is a Ralph supermarket within walking distance (5 mins) and it has everything you need. Above Ralph, there is the CVS pharamacy. If you walk down to West Pico Blvd from the hotel, there are quite a few restaurants to choose from (pizza, Chinese, Mexican etc). I believe the hotel is in a good central location. It takes approximately 10 mins to drive to Westfield Century plaza, 25-40mins to Hollywood (depending on the traffic), 20 mins to Beverly hills shopping centre, 45mins to an hour to the Citadel outlet mall. Overall, we are happy with our stay and will come back again if we are visiting LA.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: yeemun
Reviews.Content: When we booked this hotel we thought Beverly Hills real luxury and a nice location; nice location I agreed, but real luxury dream on - The whole place could do with a renovation and update for the hotel with potential! However, some of the staff are friendly and the rest could do with a course in customer care! Buffet breakfast in the restaurant very expensive and not much choice unlike some hotels I have stayed in US. We went to the one near the airport which was much more what I would have expected from the one in the Beverly Hills.

Reviews.Title: “Tired property, but with lovely and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Mantelstone
Reviews.Content: The rooms are nothing to write home about, in fact most areas of the property look like it they were furnished in the mid-seventies never to have been overhauled since. Fairly expensive rates ($200+) for what is offered, and the wireless internet whilst free is very slow unless you go for a paid option. Must however say that the staff was lovely and very helpful throughout which frankly is the only compelling reason to stay at Crowne Plaza Beverly Hills.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, as usual”
Reviews.Author: 32655Patricia
Reviews.Content: Service varied among employees. Great servidce from Club Room attendee, Front Desk and Bartender The Conceriege was less than helpful....Not there when scheduled and pre-occupied when on duty, reading newspapers, appearing disinterested in providing service.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay in L.A”
Reviews.Author: Andys89
Reviews.Content: My mate and I flew into LA at the start of March this year. It was the first time in the states and we were a bit jetlagged from the flight. We hired a car and proceeded to head to the hotel. The hotel was very easy to get to. We were able to check in around 11am which was fantastic for us since we had just been flying for 14 hours. The rooms were fantastic and the staff were really nice. The hotel restaurant and bar were also good. I would advise anybody staying here to become a priority member (it's free to join up) we received 2 bottles if water and 2 free drink cards because I joined up prior to check in. Recommended for any traveller

Reviews.Title: “Good all round performance”
Reviews.Author: Checkedout77
Reviews.Content: After a month traveling around the USA we loved the homely feel of this hotel. Our first impressions were very positive. We were welcomed on arrival and checked into a nice room on the 8th floor. The room was clean and had a nice view over Beverly Drive. The service was excellent. The concierge was spot on with restaurant reservations and tours. The hotel is about 20 minutes walk to Rodeo Drive and has an excellent big blue bus service to Santa Monica available at the door. Be aware that things are not close together in LA. It is a 20 minute drive to Hollywood and a 45 minute drive to Warner Brothers at Burbank. There are excellent restaurants within walking distance and a supermarket close by. There is also a self service laundry close by. The hotel restaurant is good and there is a nice pool. The Crowne Plaza Beverly Hills is a great midrange hotel that works well. The GM and his team have their act together. We will certainly return

Reviews.Title: “Adequate hotel - poor location”
Reviews.Author: marypuss
Reviews.Content: Whilst the hotel was adequate, we did not have a car and it was so far south in B. Hills that it did not show up on our map of B.Hills! Not sure why an earlier comment said close to Rodeo drive etc, we did not find any nice places within walking distance (we will walk up to a mile) and found a rough area with a man sleeping on the street just round the corner from the hotel. We stayed there to go to Universal Studios which meant we managed to enjoy our holiday but not the hotel. The room was OK but nothing special and the restaurant was OK but very limited especially for snacks and light meals.

Reviews.Title: “Always a good option”
Reviews.Author: ale_esteves
Reviews.Content: It was the second time we stayed there. The hotel is very confortable, bathroom has a good size and location is great too. Easy acess to all exits from LA, and there is a supermarket within walking distance. We stayed 2 nights there.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jorazz-b
Reviews.Content: This hotel well positioned for Beverly hills, near to rodeo drive and not too far from the star's homes area. For everything else there was a drive involved, although this would be the same for anywhere you stayed in LA. The room was nice and we were upgraded due to being on our honeymoon, the staff were also very helpful and friendly, apart from the bar staff who were fairly useless. We had breakfast here one morning which was average, would suggest going just round the corner to Factors. We also parked at this hotel which was 25 dollars per day, there was notarially another nearby choice for parking. We did get free wifi in the room. If you're looking to do a star homes tour, try segwow who run Segway tours, it was great fun and also a lot cheaper than some of the Segway companies (89 dollars)

Reviews.Title: “I thought the Crowne Plaza had STANDARDS!!!!”
Reviews.Author: adrianjaneb
Reviews.Content: The only reason we stayed at this hotel was to meet up with friends who had just arrived in LA (we had been in the states for 2 weeks). Check In was easy. Parking was at a price!! unfortunate as the room prices were high!!! The room was very poor. Very old in style and not something we have been use to to other Crowne Plazas. What was very surprising was after we checked in and went to our rooms my kids were checking over the room when they found some cables hanging out of the wall, upon investigation they were only the computer cables but still they should of been checked by housekeeping, upon telling the front desk they apologised and said it would be fixed. We returned to our room later that night and the cables were still hanging out. Im thinking if there was any positives from our stay, drinking in the bar with the kids was good. I think the servers names was Jesus. Another negative, if you go for breakfast with your family of 5, look at the bill, My wife and I had breakfast free but the kids we didnt, we were charged the extra gratuity of 20% (from memory i thin kit was 20%), when i question the lady regarding it she could hardly speak any english and couldnt offer any assistance, later that night i asked the night guy and he didnt know the answer ever, again disillusioned.

Reviews.Title: “Great service!”
Reviews.Author: tmc88
Reviews.Content: We only stayed here for two nights - but the stay was great. Very friendly and helpful staff. Location wasn't too bad - half way point between all the destinations. Comfy and clean rooms. Just what we were after :)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!!!”
Reviews.Author: LouiseNR
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the perfect location. Walking distace to Rodeo Drive and many eateries along the way including a grocery store which was handy to pick up neccessities for the kids. Self parking is available & is well priced. The rooms are very clean & a good size & fit our family of 4 quite well. We ate in the restaurant one night & had a grea mea. I would come back & stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Solid 4* experience”
Reviews.Author: zoe025
Reviews.Content: Overall we were pleased with our hotel choice. When we arrived the staff could not have been more helpful with our car and bags. However, when we got up to our room we had a twin room. We specified double and it was on our paperwork. We went back down, asked for a double and they had all been booked (how was ours not booked?!). I dont think the receptionist was at all appologetic. However the general manager swooped in, who was more appologetic and helped persuade her that the next day we could ask again and get what we had booked. And to be fair they did give us a King and moved our bags sucessfully. The room we ended up with was lovely, quite big and with a great view. Everything was very clean and we liked the location of the hotel too. If you have a chance walk right out the hotel into bevely hills and visit Picallo Paradiso restaurant- best Italian ever. The only other downside of this hotel was the service at breakfast, which considering the high cost I thought was deadful. It was always slow, the servers seemed harrassed and it was never a good start to the day! Oh and I dont understand why everyone else rates Tatiana the concierge, she appeared very ditzy to us and couldnt seem to be bothered to get us the dinner reservation we wanted, we gave up after lots of faffing around. Maybe she was having an off day. Overall however we were happy with our choice, it is a nice clean hotel with good rooms and largely helpful staff (particularly the general manager, perhaps he could oversee breakfast!!).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: leeoliver
Reviews.Content: The location is not the best as LA is huge. The hotel has a taxi rank outside and regular buses are nearby too. The hotel itself is packed with all you'd require to make your trip pleasant. Free wifi, 42"LCD tv, coffee making facilities, a business centre and much more. The 24hr gym was a hit with us too!! Most of all, if your someone who likes comfort, quality service and a peaceful place to reside then this is the hotel for you. Please please please see Tatiana (concierge) as she loves her job and will break her back to help anyone. She gave us everything and more and for me made our trip!!

Reviews.Title: “very enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: thepir8t
Reviews.Content: we were there in april 2010 had a gret experiance with the staff and it was in a good location yes you need a car to get around but hey we whent evrywhere santa monica peer/ hollywood/ it was a good resonable spot to stay we had a ball and we are on our way there again in june cant wait

Reviews.Title: “Very conveniently located, helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: fct1
Reviews.Content: Tatiana, the concierge, was helpful and very enthusiastic. She was keen to â€œsellâ€�. If you had found a better solution for what you wanted to do but it would involve less commission, she would most likely discourage you. So if you have a lot of dollars to spend, she is the right person to help you. If you did some basic research then donâ€™t doubt you may have a better deal â€“ example is the use of limos to show you around â€“ these are apparently better than the regular tours â€“ since they take you to their depots first. But eventually we drove to Hollywood and the atmosphere in the Starline bus was much better when taking the tour â€“ also cheaper than pre-booking over the phone. We could also enjoy the Hotelâ€™s top floor club breakfast lounge. Breakfast was good but very standard. Even plain natural yogurt seemed too much effort to try to get, so I had sugary fruit yogurt with my muesli. The room was very clean, including the bathroom and the bedding.

Reviews.Title: “It was okay but you need a car to get around.”
Reviews.Author: FigliaDiAli
Reviews.Content: The rooms are spacious and comfortable but the buffet breakfast was not great. They served the same food for our 5-day stay. The location is a bit far from the malls and downtown LA. Walking distance to Rodeo Drive though.

Reviews.Title: “A Commfortable base in Beverly Hills without blowing the bank”
Reviews.Author: DavidR63
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a pleasant five days at the Crowne Plaza. Check in was fine and the receptionist explained the local area, bus routes etc. The 7th floor room was comfortable with a view over the pool, the decor was in an older style and probably in need of a bit of upgrading, although the very large HD television was wonderful. Weather was incredibly good and it was nice for the children to chill out in the pool after a busy day. In the exactly how far is Rodeo Drive debate, I made it a good 15 to 20 minutes to Rodeo Drive Proper , although it is a very pleasant walk it can get a bit hot. The bus service to Santa Monica works very well only $1 per person on the Big Blue bus and about a half an hour ride. There are also good bus connections to the Grove and Farmers Market with the 14 bus and the 217 to Hollywood. Be warned the service interval on the 14 occassionally gets a bit long. We arranged a private car transfer to Universal Studios through Tatiana on the concierge desk, which worked out very well. I agree that eating in the immediate vicinity of the hotel is a bit limited and you have to walk up towards Beverly, which with tired children in the evening does get a bit far. We ate in the hotel one night, which was fine although the menu is a bit limited. All in all a good base for a first visit to the Beverly Hills area and we had a comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, definitely need a car to get around”
Reviews.Author: MissRAust
Reviews.Content: This was our first stop after an extremely long 16 hour flight. We had a prepaid voucher for the room for 4 nights, which clearly stated that we were a honeymoon couple. I had lost my voice and wasnt feeling very well, so didnt get to chat to the reception as much as i normally would. We didnt get upgraded to a high floor, or the quiet floor, and when we arrived in the room we had 2 double beds, really?? We were so tired though, we didnt even think about complaining or trying to get moved. Room was quite spacious, and the big TV was great. Air conditioning as mentioned by a few people is SO loud, and quite annoying through the night. And we thought it was weird there was no fan in the bathroom too, was very humid in there! Room service was average, and we didnt try the restaurants in the hotel. We went to the Beverly Drive restaurants further up 2 of the nights, which were both lovely. Quite expensive, but our food was good so we werent fussed. I really think you need a car when going to Beverly Hills however, as nothing is super close, even the restaurants. Would not stay here again, though there was nothing wrong with the hotel/rooms, it just didnt meet my expectations of the opulent Beverly Hills nor the price point that we had paid for the average room.

Reviews.Title: “comfy bed, check locaation will suit you”
Reviews.Author: eve-boots
Reviews.Content: Lovely comfortable bed. Small bathroom and as mentijoned elsewhere no fan. Also hair wasn't cleared out of the plughole so water didn't clear quickly during showers. Concierge was really helpful so ask for help. Join the Premier club as cheaper parking. Don't have breakfast, the hot food wasn't particularly pleasant and it was expensive,. Location was ok for us as we had car. LA is easy to navigate and it took about 1/2 hr to get to hollywood. We had some difficulty finding nice places to eat that were local and the only advice was to keep walking up Beverly Drive to the restaurant area, but we didn't find it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - good value”
Reviews.Author: amandajolly
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location and only minutes away from the sites. We only had a short one night stay before our trip back to the UK. The bell boy was great - reception was quick and easy and the room was lovely - we had two rooms one with one large bed - one with two double beds - both good size and very comfortable. As it was our last night of a near three week tour - we decided to stay in at night and eat in the hotel - WOW what a surprise the food, standard, service and value was excellent and I would highly rate this. The boys went into the pool as they had been in Disney all day so they loved that - it stayed open until quite late at night. Car Parking was easy - you pay for it but its right next door to the hotel. Good hotel, great location and service was as you would expect from a CP hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: Allifred
Reviews.Content: 1st impresions go with them. The 2 doormen were more interested in their own conversation than assisting us with our bags on arrival. The 2 receptionists were RUDE RUDE RUDE. It seems we interupted there conversation by wanting to check in. I had 2 waters shoved at me and my room key. No introduction re the hotel? No map ? and then they went back to their conversation. When I asked her where I could take my young family for dinner she gave me a map and circled a street. The room was terrible,the air conditioner was so noisy and turned itself on and off all night, thewalls are paper thin and as we were next to the lift and icemachine we were kept awake all night by people returning to the hotel.We got no sleep and requested to be moved the next day to another room.On returning the next night the 2 "friendly" staff were back on reception and did not move our room as she thought it was a" mistake" After I said we were kept awake all night she replied" you should be happy to be a that floor as it is a quiet floor and kids are not allowed.( I felt like yelling at her it wasn;t children running up and down the corridor drunk at 2am!.) We then moved to another room- but would never stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location to explore Hollwood, Beverly Hills and Santa Monica”
Reviews.Author: andrewt3233
Reviews.Content: We have just had 3 nights at the hotel over Easter and experienced a very well run and friendly hotel with great rooms, very helpful staff and great location for exploring. We were on the Quiet floor and did not have a problem - even though we were relatively close to the lift. As members of the Priority Club you are also entitled to use the Club Lounge on the 12th floor for complimentary breakfast - which was a nice touch and even better surprise was to find that you also got hote breakfast as well and not just continental. The parking was either self park or valet - which we used both options whilst there. Front desk staff on check in and check out could not have been more helpful- very friendly and genuine. Really annoys me when people slag off a hotel for simple mistakes that occur all the time. This hotel is not a 5 star hotel neither does it profess to be one. At the end of the day If you are coming to LA you are not going to want to spend your entire time in the hotel room - it should just be a base for sleeping in and that's all! Price range I would expect to pay for this hotel would be up to about $199 anything more than that would be in rip off territory. Working in hotels I tend to be more critical than most - but we had a great time here (which was 2nd visit) and the hotel did not disappoint.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: in2itive
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a short stay at the Crowne Plaza Beverly Hills in early April and were struck by the high level of service provided. From the moment we walked into an ornate lobby a friendly and helpful staff catered to our every need. The girls at the front desk were always there and polite and helpful. The bell boys were never short of advice or a helping hand. Our room was small but very nice and featured a comfortable king sized bed and massive HD television.

Reviews.Title: “Service & Stay excellent”
Reviews.Author: nemraC1970
Reviews.Content: had a twin room as there was 3 of us. Great staff, fabulous bar and great safe location close to shops and restaurants. Concierge was great! A lot of Australians were there too. Only negative comments - the bathroom is very small with no fan...it's get hot & steamy in there, but really was not a problem. Business centre was a small room with two computers and a printer with uncomfortable chairs - but we had our own laptop with us, so it also wasn't a problem.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints”
Reviews.Author: amc444
Reviews.Content: Had a nice time here. Good vibes. Stayed there for 7 days. They were helpful. Food was good.

Reviews.Title: “Location and service”
Reviews.Author: Zadok18
Reviews.Content: Perfect location for our purposes; the room (12th floor) had a remarkable view all the way to downtown LA as well as Hollywood; bed was comfortable and service by all staff excellent. Special kudos to Michele and Angad at front desk. This hotel was quiet and apparently very well run, at least for this middle-aged couple!

Reviews.Title: “This is the worst hotel I have stayed in EVER”
Reviews.Author: LeeAnne32655
Reviews.Content: If I could give this place a zero or negative 10 I would. I have stayed in hotels all around the world, and this is THE worst hotel yet. From hair in the room service food, constant disrupted sleep on a supposedly "quiet floor', to incompetent and rude staff. We have been here for a week whilst on our honeymoon, and its been terrible, we cant wait to leave tomorrow. We pre-paid for the hotel, and one of their many stuff ups is that they have charged nearly $1200 to our credit card for NOTHING. There was only one friendly staff member, Lorraine, but even then it appears she didnt do what she said she would. The staff here do not communicate with eachother so its impossible to fix anything -- it takes about 3 days to get your money back, even if it is their stuff up.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Value in Beverly Hills”
Reviews.Author: Barmag
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to LA and our second stay at the Crowne Plaza. We regard it as a very good base to tour from - the main streets of Beverly Hills are about 10-15 minutes easy walk, taxis are always available outside (buses too if you can master the system), plus parking is available next door for $15 a day for Priority Club members (it's easy to join and free). Ignore the complaints you see elsewhere about parking charges - they are pretty much universal in LA hotels (unlike many US cities). Consider instead the excellent value the hotel offers overall when compared to anything in or around Beverly Hills. The staff are, without exception, helpful and friendly. The concierge service is exceptional, and though we did not use it ourselves this time, we heard many guests praising it. Special mentions to Luis, the friendly barman, and to Noberto, the really helpful bellman. We checked out for two nights in the middle of our stay to travel out of town, and the staff were happy to meet our requests to store baggage and medicines under special conditions. The restaurant buffet breakfast is recommendable, though there are plenty of alternatives in walking distance. Dinner is less good, but the service is always eager. We found the bedrooms quiet and comfortable, even if the decor is a little dull and in need of freshening up. Housekeeping was efficient and unobtrusive.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: Justace
Reviews.Content: Staff are friendly,rooms are fantastic and great location!

Reviews.Title: “Good service but old hotel, location is not bad.”
Reviews.Author: gary25
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel through their website itself and i was surprised that the same category room ESA not available when I checked in. They kind of upgraded me which was ok. I was quite taken back when the bell desk just dropped my bags at the room door because it was a busy night for them (doubling up as valet as well). Breakfast in the club lounge was ok, nothing great or extraordinary. Service in the breakfast room was good. What I didn't like about the hotel was the property itself. Rooms are old, doors are squeaky and there is an old hotel smell to the property. Full marks to housekeeping department for keeping it in the best of shape possible. Concierge was also very helpful and so was front desk (angad, thanks for checking me in fast). Now the question: would I stay here again...probably not...

Reviews.Title: “Clean with amazing service and excellent staff, in the cetre of tourist attractions with great local restaurants near by. Ask to”
Reviews.Author: Mikehehir88
Reviews.Content: The hotel and it's staff are amazingly helpful especially the hotel concierge Tatiana she was amazing and could not do enough to help us with our trip and organizing transport and tickets for shows, attractions and much more. I highly reccomend this hotel and ask for Tatiana if u need anything.

Reviews.Title: “best concierge”
Reviews.Author: nerazzurriii
Reviews.Content: this hotel have the best concierge ever i was in big problem and the concierge ( tatiana ) her name, help me a lot and she told me thats she will fix my problem and she did . thank you very much tatiana I appreciate that and you are honestly the best concierge ever and about the hotel its very good its clean , nice location and nice staff

Reviews.Title: “hmmmmmmmmm, below average”
Reviews.Author: MrP78_11
Reviews.Content: Pros- Staff were nice enough and the concierge gave us good advice most of the time (but don't always go for their private car recommendations-Taxi's are more convenient and cheaper, especially if you want flexibility on the return trips home) Cons- The location sucks! As first time visitors to LA, we wanted to do the usual tourist things. But apart from the Sunset Strip and Santa Monica Pier, everything you would want to do is located near Hollywood Blvd. Since public transport is so poor in LA, getting around cost a fortune. - Cleaning; The room never seemed to receive a thorough clean, it was more like a 5 min job (which is often the hotel management's fault, not the time-pressed cleaner's). Therefore, we often returned to hairs in the shower and an unvacuumed floor. - The heater exploded at one stage, so we had to call the maintenance man in (sparks and all). It seemed like he was waiting for a tip (I don't think we should pay any extra because the hotel's facilities are in poor shape)! - On one day, (a first for us after years of frequent travel), the housekeeping actually forgot to clean our room, despite three reminder phone calls. However, we did receive a free breakfast for our troubles. - The restaurant automatically charges an 18 percent tip. We should have the discretion to tip according to the quality of the service (which wasn't terrific on the night we were there). Not a terrible hotel, but everywhere else we stayed in the US was far superior.

Reviews.Title: “Five-Star Concierge at a Three-and-a-Half Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mamulya
Reviews.Content: The Crowne Plaza suited our needs perfectly for a two-day trip to Los Angeles: great location; comfortable, if uninspired, rooms; and well-equipped bathrooms. But what truly distinguished our stay was the above-and-beyond help offered by the hotel's concierge, Tatiana Zhdanova. We frankly did not expect a mid-range hotel to offer concierge services at all, let alone the generous and expert advice given by Tatiana. Within minutes of meeting us, she was at her computer, securing tickets for a taping to the Jay Leno show. A few minutes later, she had planned out the rest of our day, sending us to Santa Monica, which we truly enjoyed, and the Getty Museum (for which she also printed out passes). Tatiana is a concierge par excellence who turns a stay at an ordinary hotel into an extraordinary experience.

Reviews.Title: “Never Had a Bad Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: DesertExec
Reviews.Content: This may be my 3rd or 4th visit in the last few years to this property which is Beverly Hills adjacent at Beverly & Pico in Los Angeles. The hotel was built in the early 80's as a Ramada Inn as I remember and the rooms, although good-sized, are more like a three-star functional space, i.e. smaller bathrooms that exit right into the bed area. It's very convenient to most of West L.A., Beverly Hills, Century City and West Hollywood. The hotel features a comfortable bar and restaurant and a very small gym area. On my visit, it was in a temporary location while renovations take place. The rooms are very comfortable, with fridges, microwaves and coffee makers. This is not a luxe property, but it is clean, functional, well-prices and convenient. I have stayed here before and will come back again. Staff is helpful and professional.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it!”
Reviews.Author: KenP91739
Reviews.Content: First off, I booked the room from Hotwire.com. Hotwire listed this hotel as being only a mile and half from the destination and the price was somewhat reasonable for the area, so it seemed alright. I later found out that the hotel was more than 3 miles from our planned destination, but that's an issue with Hotwire. We get to the hotel and check in, and then drive in to the parking garage. I ask the attendant if there are any fees for the parking garage and they tell me no. We unload everything, go up to our room and begin unpacking. My girlfriend notices that one of the sheets has what looks to be dried blood on it. Disgusting. We had room service change the sheets. We stay the night, taking a taxi back and forth between our destination and our hotel (those 3 miles cost me an additional 80 dollars in taxi cab fees). The following day, we check out. I look at my credit card statement a week later and note that there's a charge on my credit card for $48.40 from the hotel, so I call up the account department and ask what the charge was for? She tells me that's the charge for parking -- THEY DO NOT HAVE FREE PARKING AT THIS HOTEL, EVEN THOUGH THEY HAVE A PARKING GARAGE. Complete BS; I would not recommend this hotel to anyone, as the room rate was only average and things like CHARGING FOR PARKING, what I would consider a basic amenity for a hotel, is completely unacceptable in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “great stay!”
Reviews.Author: albies5
Reviews.Content: in short: staff is super nice- from front desk to bell hops valet housekeeping - everyone is so nice and helpful. beds are very comfortable one if the best of hotels I've stayed at- great sleep. great location !! sign up for priority club to get discount parking it's free to join! this is the second time I've stayed here and will be back in a few months! really like this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Honestly do not think it is worth the price you pay!!!”
Reviews.Author: Melleasa
Reviews.Content: Myself and my daughter and her fiance went to Los Angeles in August 2010 it was our first ever time to Los Angeles do not get me wrong we LOVED LOS ANGELES and myself and my father are coming back again this year in September and we cannot wait!!! We had the best of time but personnal experience at the Crowne Plaza we feel if was not really woth the amount they charge per night!!! The rooms are a bit outdated even though our room on the 9th floor was a very nice view at night l thought the rooms would be a bit more modern!! Also we had dinner one night in the restaurant down stairs in the lobby,and the menu selection was a bit sparse to the say the least and also very very over priced and honestly was not at all tasty!! We recommend that if you stay at Crowne Plaza eat somewhere else as there is a lot of nice restaurants near by!!!And also when we were there it was summer and our air conditioner in the room did not work very well!!! So please do some shopping around first before booking here!!!! Also they charge you $20 per day to park your car,we stayed 9 nights here and after feeling we paid to much for the room when we checked out we were hit with a bill of $180 for parking our car WHAT A RIP!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, good service but not as many services as they say...”
Reviews.Author: foodlover1216
Reviews.Content: The workers are amazing, they help you. But the internet is not high speed as advertised. The showers are hot if you have 1 person taking a shower!. The location is great especially if you want to go to kosher restaurants. There really is no business center, there is only 1 computer and 1 printer.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service provided by all staff.”
Reviews.Author: Coquito65
Reviews.Content: I invited my mother who is 74 to join me in this trip and we are both deeply grateful for the wonderful experience that we had during our stay. Travelling with a senior citizen I wanted to make sure that she felt comfortable and that she had a nice experience. We both had a magnificent time and we are so happy with the quality of the service provided by all staff members at the Crowne Plaza in Beverly Hills. Furthermore, my mother felt so comfortable in being able to speak in Spanish to staff members. We strongly recommend this hotel and hope to return in future.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away business travellers”
Reviews.Author: DumnATanker
Reviews.Content: Ok where to start? Since I am a Platinum Priority Club member is expect to be treated well. Not here. I get my room keys an guess what they don't work. Waited 10 minutes for replacement key. Also the key to the breakfast room didn't work either. Get in the room and it smells stale. The bed squeaked when you sat in it. The Internet sucked. Very very slow when it worked. It worked in the hallway fine but not in the room. A tech came to check it out and quickly disappeared. When I brought it up to the front desk I was pretty much blown off. I will never stay at this hotel again. I will stay at Starwood Hotels in this area for now on. Business travellers stay away.

Reviews.Title: “Have stayed here for years”
Reviews.Author: Eurail
Reviews.Content: I was a travel writer for 20 years so I am somewhat demanding about getting value for my money. My husband and I used to stayed at the Hyatt in Century City for some years, till it was sold to the Intercontinental chain. We then started staying at the Crown Plaza as all my family lives nearby. The location at the south end of Beverly Drive, just before Pico Blvd., may be out of walking distance to the main shopping and dining for some, but everything is just up the street. If you're driving into Los Angeles, ingore the conventional directions, and take the I-10 (Santa Monica Freeway) and exit at Overland, then east on Pico to the Hotel. From the I-5 (San Diego Freeway) exit at Santa Monica Blvd, then south to reach Pico. (I was born and raised in West LA) This is not the hotel for those who are looking for the luxury of a Ritz Carlton or similar. Having said this, If you spend any time in your room when traveling, you won't go wrong with a suite here, for the price of a single room elsewhere. The dining room is adequate, as is the bar and lobby. For seeing celebrities hang out at the bar of the Four Seasons. The staff is fantastic, from those who take your car, to the front desk staff and housekeeping. Two years ago Easter Sunday, my father and my father-in-law died within 2 hours of each other, mine in LA the other in Las Vegas. The hotel went out of there way to accomodate all our needs as we traveled back and forth between Los Angeles and Las Vegas for a month. TIP get a Priority Club membership. Even if you are not staying on the club floor, you'll be given a key to access the Club room and great free breakfast and free computer / internet access. If you find you like the hotel, make reservations online, then with your confirmation number call the hotel directly and ask for your favorite room. They have always accomodated us.

Reviews.Title: “Cheating consumers”
Reviews.Author: daslayerxv
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 4 nights and on the first night we were getting prepared to have an early sleep. To our surprise we found long blonde hairs strewn all over the bedsheets and bathroom floors and a particularly unclean room! We were shocked! The service was appalling and after we were given another room, it was situated next to a loud vending machine that prevented us from sleeping at night. The location is inconvenient particularly for getting to food and tourist attractions. I recommend that you don't stay at this hotel! Unless if you don't care about cleanliness.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Staff and fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: mallau
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the Beverly Hills Crowne Plaza. The staff were so friendly and went out of their way to help! Congratulations to General manager Francis Cruz for the supberb leadership of his amazing staff. Just to name a few staff , front desk staff Allie and Dennis, bell hop - Norberto, breakfast attendant in the club room ( I can't remember her name , but she was so welcoming), and Luise and Demin in the hotel bar. The hotel is just a 10 walk from Rodeo Dr. and many of Beverly Hills famous locations. South Beverly Drive has a variety of restaurants for casual and fine dining. URTH restaurant on Beverly was a super place for people watching and food! It was an added bonus to be a Priority Club member, breakfast is included and parking is less expensive. The Hotel rooms were average; we stayed on the Priority Club Floor , it had a nice view of LA and was quiet. The room was equipped with a fridge, microwave, flat screen TV, granite bathroom counter and king size bed.

Reviews.Title: “So recommend”
Reviews.Author: juicyfullondon
Reviews.Content: I don't normally write reviews but felt compelled on this occasion based on the exceptional staff and service. Front desk were brilliant - very warm manner and couldn't have been more helpful, especially Veronica. I had a room on the club level which had an awesome view across LA. The room looked recently renovated - it was very well done, cosy, contemporary decor and inviting as well as HUGE. I am going to NY soon and hope the experience can be duplicated in the Crowne Plaza there.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Decent”
Reviews.Author: ivanciment
Reviews.Content: We stayed here instead of at the Marriott Residence Inn across the street because we needed a late checkout at 6pm which this property offers albeit for $50. We prefer the kitchenettes the Marriott has but this for this brief stopover stay this was perfectly fine. Our rooms were fine; could use a bit more lighting in the rooms but it was OK. Gym was small but adequate. Elevator service was good; this is a plus over the Marriott which could be a pain with the elevators. Staff was nice. Nothing particularly good or bad stands out.

Reviews.Title: “best holiday!”
Reviews.Author: x_ox_emmyxox
Reviews.Content: Thanks to the staff especially Kenny, I had the best time in Los Angeles. Kenny told us where to go what to do value for our dollar best concierge ever.

Reviews.Title: “UCLA Basketball is close by!!!”
Reviews.Author: funlovingdad
Reviews.Content: We were looking for something close to Pauley Pavillion, and being everything near Pasadena is booked for Rose Bowl and Parade we were lucky to find this hotel. We were put on the club level with access to club room which in the morning served a great breakfast. We had great views from the 12th floor and the service was excellent. We felt very welcome there by the staff and they were very busy booking in all the TCU football fans. It was quiet and comfortable and they called the room to make sure everything was to our satisfaction. You are about 15 minute walk from Rodeo drive but a safe walk. The pool area and spa looked kept up and had people in it and the fitness room was very nice even though very small. We defineately would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place with really friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: JJAus_85
Reviews.Content: The Crowne Plaza was a great place to stay. It was in the perfect location with a car rental service just across the road which made getting around very easy. The best part about this place was the friendly staff. Veronica & Tracey were both friendly and incredibly helpful. I give this place a thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “Conceirge second to none...”
Reviews.Author: Lindagul
Reviews.Content: I travel often and have become quite the critic generally making comment on the negative aspects of my travels, however, on this occassion I must make particular attention to Kenny McCabe concierge at this Hotel for excellence in service. Kenny was extremley knowledgable and nothing was a trouble to him, his guidence and expertise in surrounding areas made our holiday at ease and complete. I felt secure in a foreign country. He is exceptional in his field and should be commended on his efforts, he went beyond his position on a daily basis... Thank you for a great experience, I shall continue to reccomend the hotel to family and friends, your staff is second to none...

Reviews.Title: “what a beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jeffinthecity
Reviews.Content: i have to say my stay was beyond plesant and relaxing.....i also have to say thank you to Tatianna at the desk for arranging most of my outings and confirming my flight back home.....i felt like i had my own personal assistant making sure i had the best stay and Tatiannas upbeat friendly personality really made me fell at home. i will definately recommend this hotel to everyone i know. thx Crowne Plaza BH

Reviews.Title: “Always welcomed home”
Reviews.Author: DKACX4
Reviews.Content: From the moment we checked in to the time of check out the staff could not have been friendlier or more helpful. The rooms were everything we were hoping for, particularly with a teenage son and daughter who were hoping for their own 'space'. Very convenient location to access all the shopping and attractions of Southern California, and although a very wet winter we found everything suited to our needs and wants for this vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Very polite and helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: anjan2210
Reviews.Content: The stay is comfortable, food is standard and TVs in the room are 52" with HD channels. The hotel is an average one with a few rough edges like bad plumbing or a cupboard that does not close properly (these are taken care of when reported). However, I can't stop praising the staff starting from the front-desk to the waiters, to the room service guys who are extremely polite and helpful (they deserve 5 stars on this one). Overall it's a comfortable place.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for Los Angeles visit”
Reviews.Author: m-byrne-6
Reviews.Content: Hotel perfectly located close to everything of interest with Metro just outside hotel. Staff very helpful and could not give us any more help with any information we required. Hotel very clean and every thing we required was there. Room very clean with daily cleaning and a daily supply of tea milk and sugar to room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelbatty
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful despite the large group they had to take care of. The rooms were nice, clean, with excellent comfortable beds. The pool was very pleasant to sit by and the hotel lounge was nice. Overall an excellent experience.

Reviews.Title: “The staff is by far the friendliest ever!”
Reviews.Author: snowdayking
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are traveling from Australia on holiday for 3 weeks. Our first stop was LA and we stayed at the Crowne Plaza. Everyone was so nice and accommodating. One morning we needed our room cleaned after 1pm, and when we called the front desk, the young lady I spoke to said she would have housekeeping come right up. It was not more than 10 minutes. I was very impressed. The beds were amazing and so comfortable!! Then, we had a very early check out and were extremely tired and a bit grouchy from lack of sleep. When we approached the desk, a very awake and smiley Allie was there to greet us. We came down a bit too early and had a little wait for our shuttle. James gave me a paper to read and Allie gave us each a bottle of water. They engaged in conversation with us and made the time go by fast. They are very professional and knowledgeable in their positions and both made sure our every need was taken care of. And, Allie is funny. I'd say that the last 20 minutes my wife and I spent in the lobby with James and Allie was the clincher. We're returning to LA in May 2011 for our son's graduation, and because of them, we have added the Crowne Plaza Beverly Hills as our hotel.

Reviews.Title: “More than met our needs”
Reviews.Author: tarcat71
Reviews.Content: We could certainly have found a newer hotel, but the staff is what sold us. They were constantly going out of their way to make sure we were comfortable. One person in particular was the Priority Club breakfast attendant, Maria. She was the most considerate person we have ever come across. She is the jewel in the Crowne! The hotel staff remembered our name and why we were there. They constantly were asking if we needed anything. The hotel is very clean. It is centrally located to dining and easy access to interstates and attractions. We may have to return to LA and if we do...no hesitation as to where we will stay!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic staff - friendly and helpful”
Reviews.Author: gabdy
Reviews.Content: Only arrived yesterday here at this hotel - all pre-booked before leaving Australia through a travel agent. After being in Anaheim for the past couple of days since arriving from Aussie, and having a hotel there that saw us having to carry all bags up 2 flights of stairs (no assistance offered, we were expecting that perhaps this would be our lot for the weeks to come. Not so at this hotel. From the time we arrived, the staff have been fantastic and just the friendliest that you could hope for when you are so far away from all that you know. From Lorraine at the front desk, to Louis in the lovely bar/restaurant and the friendly cheery doormen,and the concierge staff, it has so far been a pleasant experience. Nothing seems to be too much trouble for them. They even confirmed our tours for us. The rooms are clean and well appointed. Bed is comfortable, although the air con clicking on and off all night takes a bit of getting used to. These guys have got it right when it comes to "Happy staff makes for happy guests".

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: K2RDad
Reviews.Content: I was here for a school and had a presentation due the next day that somehow was currupted. I was in the business office having a hard time when the manager Angad came in to see if I needed help. He took me into his personal office for over an hour and worked on it with me. When we still had problems, he offered to bring his personal computer from home to work the next day to give me further assistance. I see "whatever the guest needs" said often, but I felt that here it was more than a catch phrase and saw it in action. The entire staff was very helpful and friendly!

Reviews.Title: “fab stay!”
Reviews.Author: harpo86
Reviews.Content: Just had a client come back from Crowne plaza, she said the hotel and staff were brilliant, location was excellent, couldnt have asked for anything more!!!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Service! Great location! Very reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: RASHMITA
Reviews.Content: The moment we checked in I had a very good feeling about the hotel. All the hotel stuff were very friendly and were trying to help you with minute details. You will immediately feel that they are really trying to provide the best service that they can. I told the hotel manager that we would checked out the following morning at around 8 AM (as we bought tickets for LA city tour) and that we would like to keep our luggage in the hotel until evening 8 PM. Angad not only readily agreed to it but also told us that he would make a room available for us so that we can get fresh and change. This was a pleasant surprise to us that any hotel would allow us to use their hotel room (after checking out) to get fresh. We came back at 8PM and he offered a room without any additional charge just to get fresh. The hotel rooms are quite big and super clean. They have a 42" LCD TV, free wireless connection. I would definitely come back to this hotel in the future

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful help and support for credit card fiasco”
Reviews.Author: cistraveler
Reviews.Content: The staff at the hotel could not have been friendlier. I really should have been asked if I wanted the charge to stay on my card and then there would have no hold on my card but instead there was money that needed to be dropped off. One of the staff people, Lorraine was helpful above and beyond the call of duty. She suffered through a series of phone calls from me and was never short or rude but tried her best to help address the situation. She even participated in two conferece calls with the credit card company. My next trip to LA will definitley include a stay at this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, good value & location”
Reviews.Author: chantal04
Reviews.Content: Just writing to recommend the Crowne Plaza, Beverly Hills. I stayed there for nearly two weeks and found the hotel to be great. All of the staff were very friendly and helpful. The location is also very good, it is situated in a nice section of Beverly Hills, it has character and the rooms are clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest Staff”
Reviews.Author: vflint
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Crowne Plaza for two nights and can not get over how friendly the staff was. From the time we arrived to the time we left we never ran into one staff member that wasn't happy to be there. It started with the general manager who showed us the way to our room. We decided to eat dinner the first night at the hotel. Our waiter, Miguel Valadez was so good we decided to have dinner there a second night. The morning breakfast crew was awesome as well, Julie Vargalui and Maria Gialvez. My husband loved the service and loved that they recognized him throughout the trip

Reviews.Title: “Hotel staff aren't responsible with your bags and luggage and blame your for loses when it their possession!”
Reviews.Author: maam41
Reviews.Content: We checked out of this establishment a couple of days ago with one of our bags being lost by hotel staff and the hotel refuses to accept responsibility for it and blames us for the lost item. The reason why I say hotel staff is because the hotel bell person collected our luggage and this particular bag and housed it for us whilst we had dinner in the hotel restaurant while we waited for our shuttle bus airport transfer. When going to claim our luggage our luggage was there but this distinctive bag was missing. When raising the concern with the hotel staff I was told that I must have surely lost it as they didn't have it,and tourists always misplace bags, which is not true. 4 of us saw the bell person leave our hotel room with it! The hotel refuses to accept responsibility for the lost item. Very disappointed with this establishment.

Reviews.Title: “good city centre hotel - would stay again”
Reviews.Author: lynda4136
Reviews.Content: Hotel room clean with great views of the city and could just make out the Hollywood sign. Rodeo Drive only 15-20 mins walk away or catch the local bus from outside the hotel. Using the bus to get to Rodeo Drive we caught other buses to Manns Chinese Theatre; Universal Studios and Santa Monica. Each bus ride is only $1.50 whether you are on the bus 2 or 3 stops or 30 stops and are regular and easy to use making getting around the city very economical. Although we didnot eat at the hotel and used it as a base to do what we wanted we couldnot fault the hotel whilst we were staying there. There were plenty of restaurants within 10 mins along the walk to Rodeo Drive. - most of which were reasonable in price and varied choice. We had read other peoples negative reviews on trip advisor but were pleasantly surprised how good it was. The staff were friendly and helpful and the hotel room had everything we needed except a room safe - which would have been nice but not essential. We would certainly stay in the hotel again if we were visiting the Hollywood area, although LA is so big everything is a long way from everywhere else. We would recommend this hotel to other travellers as our stay was without fault.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Enough Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DanielGK2
Reviews.Content: The Crowne Plaza Beverly Hills is a pleasant enough hotel. The room was clean. King size bed was comfortable. Sheets were changed regularly. The staff was polite and willing to help, but I didn't run into any real problems. Heating/AC worked fine. The internet, as others have pointed out, was bad. Service went down repeatedly. When it worked the WiFi was slow. Air quality indoors wasn't that great either. Many of the complaints seem to be coming from tourists who figured out too late that the location doesn't put you on Hollywood Boulevard. Well it doesn't. But it's fine for business travelers on a budget who aren't too demanding. Research where you want to go before you book a hotel. Keep in mind transportation costs.

Reviews.Title: “Will not return”
Reviews.Author: Beachwalker5
Reviews.Content: Generally the room and facility were nice. Unfortunately too many negatives occurred during our stay, turning what could have been a nice stay into an unpleasant one. First, a rude valet attendant demanded our daughter move her car from a registration parking space while we were registering; he said he needed the space, even though she explained we were registering. Throughout our stay, the entry system did not work and we had to make multiple attempts with our card keys to try to enter our room, wasting 10-15 minutes of our time. We called the front desk both days and technicians were sent. On the second day, the tech made some repairs and the system appeared to work, but I could not re-enter our room the next morning. On the second morning, there was no hot water due to a problem with the boilers. The room and amenities were nice. The food in Marty's Bistro was good.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here you won't regret it”
Reviews.Author: EljayAdelaide
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of "those" sort of places travellers dream about finding. Clean, comfortable, quiet, friendly, close to great food, wonderful neighborhood and reasonably priced. The bed and pillows were probably one of the best I have stayed at in a hotel anywhere. Try and get a room up a little higher above the surrounding buildings on the Southern side. If so, you will have LA and Hollywood, including the famous "sign" all spread at your feet out the window. It was, to be succint, spectacular. AND you can get a bowl of porridge at the restaurant for $4! Bonus!

Reviews.Title: “dont stay here”
Reviews.Author: docholidays
Reviews.Content: Hate to be whinger but I won't bother wasting too much energy on this hotel.Prepaid for my room with a travel voucher through adventure holidays some 6 months in advance .Like some other reviewers arrived to be told they did not have our room ready when it was about4 pm and various other excuses and lies involving the travel voucher people culminating in a 2-3 hr wait watching numerous people booked in ahead of us and being ignored by staff.I assume they just gave my room away as they figured we werent coming and they could make a fast buck.Finally they only seemed to understand my anger and I was hastily shown a tobacco smelling tired old room which was otherwise ok but hardly memorable.The concierge was indundated meantime with people making bookings for the next day and by the time I was able to get an appointment with him-after 90 minutes to confirm my Universal studio gold pass fot the next day it was too late as the studio had packed up for the day. The hotel is a long way from nowhere in particular[ but reasonable walking distance to some restaurants] but really a long way from Hollywood.The breakfast was good however.Beware of making local calls, three short phone calls to Newport beach were charged to my room at 150 dollars US, and after my experiences in this hotel I was able to negotiate that to 50% of the fee, but I'm not sure if this was some payback or just another lie.The desk staff were mostly unfriendly and unhelpful ,the front door boys were ok though.Don't stay here,there are many better hotels

Reviews.Title: “Just another city hotel”
Reviews.Author: Andrea G
Reviews.Content: Bedroom ticked the boxed in comfort and space, Bar had little atmosphere, not a great location for any evening entertainment, a car is a must. Staff were not all that friendly or helpful. Coming from San fransciso it was a bit disappointing but it's ok. The LA restaurant about 1/2 mile walk away towards the shops was amazing thou. Oh and to park will cost you an arm and a leg.

Reviews.Title: “Very Average Hotel - Get what you pay for I guess”
Reviews.Author: JTGLS
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the last night of a 35 day holiday in the USA. We decided that as it was our last night and we were only staying one night so we would not spend much on the room. Well you certainly get what you pay for. Rooms were very tired, lifts were very slow and the location is at the very edge of Beverly Hills. Staff were friendly and helpful. We did not use any of the facilities as we checked in and out within 24 hours. The room booked was a standard king bed room. We were traveling with our two children (8 year old and 1 year old). Cot supplied at not added cost and as the bed was a king bed we let the 8 year old sleep with us because it was just one night. If you are looking for quality rooms and good location don't book here.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable Hotel, poor location.”
Reviews.Author: aussievicgirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights. The rooms seem to be somewhat outdated. Our room was clean. The hotel itself is of a reasonable standard. But there wasn't anything special, or outstanding about it. Biggest criticism is it's location and talking to other (mostly Aussie) tourists, they all seemed to be saying the same thing. It's too far away from just about everything a tourist would be interested in seeing while in L.A. We walked to Rodeo Drive which took around 30 minutes. Lucky for us we were happy to walk and we enjoyed it. If you want to go any of the other tourist attractions in L.A. you'll need use public transit, or take a cab, or private car, which are readily available at the hotel. Personally I'd pay the extra cash and get a private car, we had an excellent and safe driver. My experience of cab drivers in L.A. was unfortunately terrible, and that's being polite about it. The restaurant at this hotel was average and overpriced for what you got . There wasn't anything close by to have as an alternative. So you're kinda stuck with what's on offer at the hotel as far as food goes. Our experience with the staff was good. We found them friendly and helpful. If I ever decide to stay in L.A. again I wouldn't allow my travel agent to book this hotel for a second time.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here if you need internet access”
Reviews.Author: ccv111
Reviews.Content: Ordinary hotel, not a great location as to where it is, but it is easy to walk to the nicer part of Beverly Hills. While internet access is free it is useless and I was there on business and it was impossible to get any work done. Breakfast staff good and prices reasonable, rooms clean. Other staff not well trained for good customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like I was living in a ghost town, run-down and disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Marissssa
Reviews.Content: For the amount of money you spend to stay at the BHCP, I'm sure you could've gotten somewhere closer to the actual hussle and bussle of LA. First things first, I think what people need to understand is LOS ANGELES is so big with sooo much to do, so finding the right place would have to be on a priority list, as I just followed a suggestion from a different Traveller group. I was travelling with my best mate, both 21 - meeting friends in the area. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful, One day we booked a chaffeur service from the hotel to Santa Monica to Burbank and Back - $180 - and the chauffuer guy we had was full of himself - meaning he thought he was above everyone, talking about how he's clothes were better than what we had. The rooms were .. small, out-dated and had a stench, though I will say my bed sheets were changed daily and nothing to fault on cleaniness. A safe would of been nice to have. The free-internet downstairs is 2 computers, for the whole hotel - which made it a lil bit of a hassle with 6-8 people waiting each time, so being Jet-lagged I went down around 5am for my internet catch-ups. To be honest, yes the hotel is not too far from Rodeo Drive, but that Drive is not the only thing in Hollywood, I spent about $800-$1000 in travelling for a week in LA - which totally put a downpour on things. At night, there was no one on the streets and we did make a trip to a Jewish Subway at 4am in the morning and the manager walked us home because he thought it was too unsafe to walk back. We used a laundro-mat (from the main entrance, turn left, find the main road, turn left and walkdown about 400 metres, worked out to be $3 to wash and dry all my clothes. Overall, I would not stay at the BHCP again as it was kinda depressing and run-down, as a preference next time, I'd book somewhere in Santa Monica and maybe take a day trip to LA.

Reviews.Title: “More like a motel than other Crowne Plaza hotels”
Reviews.Author: Alex2607
Reviews.Content: We arrived about 11pm. Check-in was efficient, we brought sodas and chips from 'the Pantry' a small shop off the reception with a very limit range. $3 per bottle for sodas, we later found out they could be brought from vending machines on accommodation floors for $1.50c. Room was a reasonable size and contained 2 queen beds as requested. Ceiling was painted concrete and walls contained cold white wallpaper, bathroom was extremely small. Hotel is marketed as a modern 4 star hotel, in reality it is a 3 star hotel at best with very old fashioned furnishings. Room service was variable, reception service was ok, best service given by a young guy in the mornings. Concergie service was terrible. Public internet in business centre was constantly down. Hotel is not close to much but Hollywood, the LA CBD and Santa Monica can all be reached by a regular public bus less than 2 mins walk away. For dining I would reccommend Factors and the Chinese restaurant on on Pico Blvd. Be aware that the Crowne Plaza is situated in the Jewish district so all restuarants except Factors close on Friday evenings. Did not try hotel restuarant, hotel bar prices were reasonable. Hotel service were poorly promoted during stay and it bared no comparison to the Crowne Plaza in Kuala Lumpar that I stayed in December 2009, which is a very nice hotel with excellent location, facilities and services.

Reviews.Title: “Dont Go There”
Reviews.Author: Ausigirl_10
Reviews.Content: We would not ever stay there again! firstly our linen had dreadfull stains on it and had to be changed,the room was so small we had to move the bedside table to close the bathroom door,the furnishing were old and damaged not elegant. towels hard no mini bar or safe 1 restraunt not 6 staff had fingers in our food walls had to be repaired due to running water.others staying had same coments

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in an ordinary location”
Reviews.Author: Antilooped
Reviews.Content: We travelled to BHCP in April 2010. The hotel met our expectations - clean and comfortable but nothing to write home about. Staff were friendly. We were put up in a high level in the corner apartment (was roomy); the view was ordinary. We didnt see many people - in fact it was like we were staying in a "ghost hotel" saying that it was great for sleep and privacy but horrible for security - we were always on edge leaving our things in the room with no safe. The restaurant is expensive for what you get. The location is very ordinary - if you dont have a car its going to be costly as the only way to move is on foot (you could reach rodeo drive in 20mins of solid walking) or cabs which are costly to get anywhere. Overall we liked the hotel but we would not go back due to the location.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad hotel, would stay elsewhere for the same money.”
Reviews.Author: Jerseybob175
Reviews.Content: I arrived on Sunday, August 8, 2010 at approx. 6 p.m. for a three-day business trip. I had used the Blue shuttle from LAX. ($20 and almost 1.5 hrs. I would not recommend the Blue or the Red Shuttle unless you have enough people to fill the van. Too many stops) I was greeted promptly at the front desk. I supplied gave my reservation number and Crowne Plaza number. I was given a room on the top floor (12th) with the requested king bed. The lobby was clean as well as appointed with a small shop and large bar on either side of the lobby. Elevator service was quick and easy. The room was furnished with a king bed, two night tables, a clock radio, large LG brand flat screen, desk, chair, lounge chair, microwave, refrigerator and coffee maker. The bathroom was small but sufficient with a blow dryer and some common toiletries and plenty of towels. The room was very clean as was the bathroom. A wake up call was left for 7 a.m. The wakeup call was prompt and a complimentary copy of U.S.A. Today was left at my door. Breakfast is not provided for guests. The hotel offers room service, and a full service breakfast as well as a breakfast buffet for a fixed price ($16.) I opted for a nearby coffee shop. Upon my return to the room the phone message indicator was flashing. To make a long story short, it flashed for three days, on both room phones, with no messages being left. (The desk could not correct this issue.) The naked hanger in the bathroom suddenly displayed a very nice terry cloth robe for my use. Day two, I discover that breakfast IS provided on the 12th floor for hotel club members (very good food with nice people and free). I also find out that the hotel members are also entitled to two glasses of wine or two draft beers at the bar. Shame on the front desk for sharing the member benefits with me when I checked in and not giving me a key to the memberâ€™s clubroom. Use of the club level room was disappointing due to the COMPUTER AND PRINTER being out of service for the entire three days. I did use the pool and hot tub and they both were clean and well stocked with pool towels. Day 3, I used the lobby computer to try and print my boarding passes, but BOTH printers were not working. The staff at the desk did step in and print all the boarding passes for guests. Check out was a breeze and the cab ride to LAX ($43.00) was split with another hotel guest going to the airport as well. Next visit for business I will stay at the Residence Inn across the street for no other reason than past exp. with Residence Inn has never let me down.

Reviews.Title: “Stay some place else.”
Reviews.Author: vincess
Reviews.Content: I have never stayed at a Crowne Plaza, but after this stay I never will, this place is bad. This hotel is not located in the Beverly Hills that you are thinking of, but it is not very far (in terms of distance) from the real Beverly Hills. You will need a car or take taxis. But this place is terrible. We stayed there for three nights and would strongly advise that you stay else where. We rented two rooms, adjoining (husband, wife, and three teenagers). Upon making our reservation, we requested a roll away bed (a cot). Upon arrival we again requested the cot. Upon entering our room we had to ask to have the bathroom cleaned again, it (the toilet) and the bathroom were both dirty, you know what I mean?). Before we went to dinner we again requested the cot. When we got home from dinner we again requested the cot. It showed up at about 10:30 at night. Only four requests for a cot! My daughter slept in the cot and said it smelled of cigarettes, it did. On our first night, for some reason the window (to the alley between our hotel and the neighboring apartment type building) was left open. The smell of bacon and breakfast cooking at 3:30 AM was nauseating, literally! The next morning we requested to have the sheets changed in the cot, guess what, they did not change them. We had to make the same request at 9:00 at night and they did respond. Rooms were OK in size (not large by any means). The whole place is dated and needs a serious upgrade. Parking is convenient, in a parking garage next door (additional charge). The restaurant in the hotel and the lobby in the hotel were dirty, basically disgusting. The carpets were stained the chairs were dirty, it was bad. The most impressive person in the hotel was the waiter in the restaurant where we had breakfast twice. The restaurant was extremely over priced for a basic buffet, but the waiter was excellent. I believe his name was Juan. He was pleasant, accommodating and could not do anything more to please you, but he needs to make a move to a different restaurant. You should really consider other places before staying in this place.

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't live up to its brand name”
Reviews.Author: the-surveyor
Reviews.Content: What a disappointing hotel. It is living off its brand name and perceived location but fails in most aspects. First the rooms. We had interconnecting rooms which should have been a King and twin Queens, but were a pair of twins. One coffee maker didn't work, I had to make running repairs to two aspects of one bathroom including getting my hand into the toilet cistern. The rooms are dated in terms of decor, fixtures and fittings and require a full renovation to compete with the other hotels in the LA area at a similar price. Offering free WiFi does not make it any better. The hotel reception staff are surly. The concierges/valet parkers/bellboys are all on the make, trying to suggest expensive options when all you want is a taxi to the airport. Service is poor. Only one room was made up and when we asked for the other room to be made up 'within the hour' two hours later it still had not been. The location is not great for Beverly Hills. It is a long walk from Rodeo Drive and only Jews seeking accommodation in the heart of a Jewish area will be satisfied with the location. Overall, an unhappy experience made worse by our far more positive experiences at other hotels of a similar price in LA and San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy Beds....”
Reviews.Author: actanonverba
Reviews.Content: We arrived from Australia, and after a long flight and a reasonable trip from the airport all we were looking for was a comfy bed, in a nice area for the 3 days of our stay. The beds were exactly that, had a great sleep. Found our floor to be quiet, and the hotel was overall, clean. It was a seemingly safe area and was within walking distance to shopping etc. However, after placing some items at the office in which we were told would be safe until we collected them (due to the items being too large for safety deposit boxes), on the evening before we were to leave it took staff a few hours to locate our items (which were found in the lost property room) and we discovered that a $200 passport hard drive, had been stolen. The staff member that returned the bag was adamant that it was given back as it had been handed in at the beginning of our stay. Was not happy with how the situation was handled. Lesson learnt.. Unfortunately this ruined the "nice" stay we were having and consequently wouldnt go back.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable and overpriced”
Reviews.Author: 1_Meerkat_1
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights in mid-July. The rooms are clean, have enough room, but the bathrooms are very small. Pool is freezing. Staff are friendly and helpful. Having stayed in Holiday Inns as well, I think this hotel is more on par with a Holiday Inn than a Crowne Plaza. If you can get a good price for the accom, then I'd recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay, location is great and very reasonable rates”
Reviews.Author: Barbaram612
Reviews.Content: In researching a place to stay in Los Angeles, I wanted to stay close to Santa Monica because I was visiting my daughter. The rates at the Crowne Plaza were very reasonable. The room was very clean, service was excellent, bed was amazing. We were given the 11th floor so we had a great view of the city. Management was very nice and helpful. Pool was very nice, service at the pool was great. We stayed for 11 days so the great service continued throughout. I would totally recommend this hotel to anyone staying in the Los Angeles area...

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: JudithL9
Reviews.Content: From the doorman to the housemaid everyone was so friendly. We stayed on the Priority Club Floor and our room was clean, the bed very comfy and the view spectacular. Breakfast on the Club Floor was always fresh and plentiful. Nothing was a problem for the front desk staff, no matter how trivial the request (I couldn't work out which coins were which and they were happy to help) Will go back there in a heart beat. Home away from home!

Reviews.Title: “Loud neighbors, gross carpet, pleasant staff”
Reviews.Author: Marg_O_Lloyd
Reviews.Content: For the $125 a night rate I got off Priceline, I didn't expect anything fancy--as a business traveler, I just wanted clean, peaceful and safe. At check in, my only request was for a quiet room. The receptionist assigned me a room on the third floor. Maybe it was just my bad luck, but the first night of my stay screaming teenagers ran up and down the halls for hours. I finally called security at 2:45am. The second night's drama was a couple having a loud argument in the hallway. (Fortunately they were British, and so were very polite, apologetic, and quieted down immediately when I popped my head out of my door.) My room's carpet was pretty disgusting and quite stained--I kept my socks on at all times. So the hotel failed on clean and peaceful. But on the positive side, I never felt unsafe, even as a woman alone at night in the parking structure. The few employees I interacted with were pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Poor quality and serive for a Crowne Plaza!”
Reviews.Author: Droopydrawrs52
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent the last 3 nights of our 16 day trip from San Fran to LA here and it was the worst hotel we stayed in. We were greeted at the check in with! Heres you two free bottles of water" any more you pay! No hello how are you! For a Crowne Plaza its mote Travel lodge in everyway .Rooms werent too clean ,club lounge food was cold ,food was rubbish and the tour dea/bell man did not have a clue about any thing other than the tours he was trying to sell so he could get a back hander! We asked about where to eat "No idea",Jazz clubs"no idea",gallaries "no idea". Its a shame as Crowne plazas are usully good but not this one

Reviews.Title: “Close to Rodeo Drive, but a world away”
Reviews.Author: Jen D
Reviews.Content: The Crowne Plaza is an average hotel, a little dowdy, though the staff are friendly and the location is within walking distance of Rodeo Drive. The hotel has a shiny bar and restaurant downstairs, and a gift shop that sells food and magazines, but the rooms upstairs leave a lot to be desired. There's no mini-bar - just a drinks vending machine in the hallway - and there is no room safe. The hairdryer is also puny, though you do get Aveda toiletries. One of the worst parts of the hotel rooms cannot be seen - you can hear everything that happens in the hallway and the next room. The rattling mini-fridge and air conditioner don't help. On the plus side, the wi-fi is free. On the downside, it is very slow. I wouldn't recommend this hotel. For those on a budget only.

Reviews.Title: “Just who IS the concierge?”
Reviews.Author: johno555
Reviews.Content: During our hotel experiences on our American holiday, we found LA to have the worst customer service. The concierge was whoever was hanging around at the time. No advice or direction was given as to the public transport system. They were more interested in selling you their tours or their affiliates tours then telling you the easiest and cheapest way to get around. Also, if you ask for something, for eg. a coffee? Explain exactly how you want your coffee before they walk away on you. The only good thing about this hotel is the location, nearby restaurants & cafes are just around the corner but you have to find them for yourself because the concierge at the time will give you a weird looking map that makes no sense!

Reviews.Title: “clean, comfortable and great location!!”
Reviews.Author: alli123
Reviews.Content: My Boyfriend and I have just returned from a 12 night stay in California and our first stop was LA. After a long 10 hour flight this hotel room was just what we needed. Check in was fast and efficent, the room was spacious and clean. I dont really know where the people were looking who said it was dated as we didnt think this at all, we thought the lobby and corridors were very well presented. The staff were all lovely and so helpful! Very good location, 10 min walk to Rodeo Drive, I would recommend staying in Beverly Hills rather than Hollywood and drive to points of interest. I couldnt give this hotel a better write up, parking in $20 per day which we thought was reasonable for the city! If you are lucky enough to be going to LA then look no further than the Crowne Plaza, you will not be disappointed. Enjoy, we certainly did!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Rooms - Poor Bathrooms”
Reviews.Author: rutlanderUk
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights in LA. They were very ameanable to our religious needs as orthodox Jews. Rooms are good sizes but the bathrooms are POOR!!! When i mentioned this to the manager he said that he knew they were bad and acknowledged they were some of the worst in the business!!!
