As it was our honeymoon they gave us access to the business lounge with complimentary breakfast and internet. Location was good and maximum 20min drive to everywhere we wanted to get too. Parking wasnt cheap - $17/day

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service, great value and nice location”
Reviews.Author: aussieoioioi33
Reviews.Content: we had a fantastic stay at the Crowne Plaza Beverly Hills. The staff were exceptional in helping us locate a lost bag left a LAX. The hotel was a little old in the photos but I can guarantee this is not the impression you get upon arrival. The rooms are clean and thank suitable. Each room has a flat screen LCD t.v and satelite coverage. We found the free internet more than suffice. The bar area was really warm and friendly and the staff at the restaurant were exceptional.. I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Fluffyalbert
Reviews.Content: Before we travelled to america i did read all the reviews on this hotel and was quite concerned at what we would find. I was pleasantly surprised. The rooms were clean and tidy, the staff could not have been more helpful and we found it a great spot to walk to "rodeo drive" we got the local bus to "santa monica" pier to $3 return on the advice of staff. would recommend this hotel and would certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed, wouldn't recommend”
Reviews.Author: Ashjay40
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 days in May. I was travelling with my six month old daughter and sister. The hotel is older and felt very run down. The rooms were of a reasonable size but the bed linen was old and stained. The cot they provided for my baby was old and I thought dangerous. The bathroom was small and old. The hot water took approximately 10 minutes to warm up and only did so when I had the bath and sink taps going at the same time. The staff weren't overly friendly and didn't go out of their way to help out when I had a number of queries. Prior to staying here I had recommended some friends come and stay while we were staying. I had to apologise profusely for making them spend money on such a poor hotel. The only thing this hotel has going for it is location. I had an ok time in LA but feel had I chosen a better hotel I would have had a happier experience. I wouldn't recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “lives off the name”
Reviews.Author: corknomad
Reviews.Content: Not the best hotel. Good for location and you would need a car/taxi transportation but that is all.Once you got to the hotel and you were registered then it was a done deal you are here and we do not have to do anything else for you. The service was not great, the food was awful and the staff were indifferent. They lived off the reputation of name of the hotel, this was not even 2 star quality. Very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: BrazilRenata
Reviews.Content: The rooms are good size and bathroom too. Location is fine, not walking distance of many things. Breakfast is very expensive!!!! Not an A+, but is a B hotel at resonable price. Go.

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't either bother...”
Reviews.Author: LindyMars
Reviews.Content: We book this hotel a month or so in advance and checked in early afternoon, yet they didn't inform us that we had the last room left and it was near the Ice Machine which depending on your hearing as to how well you can sleep. When we complained to management of all different levels it fell on deaf ears and they just gave us breakfast vouchers - which was generous, however didn't solve the issue. They then said that whilst we would be out for the day, they will move us to another room. When we got back around 8pm that evening they had moved the wrong people & wanted to know if we still wanted to be moved... I've travelled a lot, but have never been treated like this at a hotel. I will never go back & I'd question if I would ever use a Crowne Plaza Hotel or any hotel in that chain again....

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ustripfeb2010
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay here! Staff were fantastic! The rooms were very clean and the Sleep Advantage beds are amazing! Book in advance to get the best rate. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: Danneesek4U
Reviews.Content: cute place with good staff, normal prices, great location in the heart of Los Angeles

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: renatib
Reviews.Content: I was a bit hesitant about booking this hotel, but it ended up being a great experience. Really nice staff, clean hotel, etc...no complaints

Reviews.Title: “Older hotel but clean and provides good service”
Reviews.Author: RubyPoko
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a 7 night stay in this hotel. From my opinion the Hotel can certainly do with an upgrade as it is that bit older, the rooms are quite small but more importantly they are clean and the service from the hotel staff we received was always pleasant. If you don't mind walking, it is not really that far to Rodeo Drive, Sax Fifth Ave etc. (10-15mins) and along the way there is some very nice restaurants & cafe's where you can dine. California Kitchen have great meals and if you like mexican food there is a fabulous restaurant called Frida which I highly recommend, the food is delicious! If you love a good burger then try Islands Fine Burgers on Beverly Drive. A cab drive is definate when going out to the Sunset Strip but not far and not that pricey. Overall, I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel”
Reviews.Author: awayweg0
Reviews.Content: This hotel is NOT 3 1/2 stars. It is dirty, scuff marks everywhere, the maid looked through our things, but did not bother to give us clean towels, I guess she was too busy. They should be embarrassed that this hotel looks like this. Dirty carpets, bed bugs, etc.

Reviews.Title: “2 stars not 3.5”
Reviews.Author: biggie003
Reviews.Content: Not at all what I expected. Rooms are so so at best. I have a gorgeous close up view of someones balcony full of crap. All the tv channels reception is fuzzy, and the interenet service......forget about it........goes offline every 45 secs -2 mins.......takes anywhere from 30 secs to 2 mins for a page to load. If you have work to do, be prepared to sit in front of your laptop for a long time..... My room is clean, yet small........not happy nor impressed with anything here.....will not stay here again...

Reviews.Title: “Avoid This Hotel...”
Reviews.Author: DG_Texas
Reviews.Content: There is nothing "elegant" about this hotel, as described on most booking sites. Arrived late in the afternoon, very tired from our flight, only to be told our room was not ready. During the "wait" for our room, I lost my prescription sunglasses. Finally received a room key, only to find the room very small, not fresh, and the bathroom extremely SMALL. About an hour later we realized we had an adjoining room with a paper-thin door between the rooms and we could literally hear everything being said in the next room. We complained and asked for a non-adjoining room on a quieter floor and were moved. This seemed better until I listened to the gentleman next door take a pee and flush! Hotel is in dire need of a make-over and the price is way too high for what you get. Staff put on a good smile, but then just avoid your issues. Such as my sunglasses... I was told they were "attempting" to contact housekeeping but no one was answering. What elegant hotel doesn't have constant contact with their staff??? Free internet did not work most of the time. We gave up and used our air-card. Parking was $22 per day and there is no indoor entry from the garage to the hotel. And, of course, it was raining most of the days of our stay... Food was very expensive and service poor. My husband was served a very pricey dry piece of chicken and tasteless mashed potatoes that had to be returned to the chef. By the time the next plate arrived, I was just about finish with dinner. And to make things worse, this was our ANNIVERSARY! We even told the waiter it was our special day and no perks were offered. They never found my designer, prescription sunglasses... It's sad when you are glad to leave and go home! DG Dallas, Texas

Reviews.Title: “Worth the stay just for the buffet breakfast staff”
Reviews.Author: VNess0301
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 7 nights. 2 adults and 2 children aged 13, 10 and 2 in a King Suite. , This features a kitchenette, lounge room, large walk in robe, seperate vanity area and seperate king bed room. The suite has two TVs, microwave, and free internet.The two older children slept comfortably on the fold out sofa in the lounge room. The room is not overly flash in its decor but its very comfortable,clean and spacious. Its a good walk to Rodeo Drive, about half hour, but you would need transport everywhere else which the taxis right at the front of the motel are great to use. Be wary of tours. Best to use the limousine tour you can get through the concierge to take you on stars homes tours etc. The ones on the strip seem a little dubious. The reason we ended up absolutely loving this motel even though it was not within walking distance of the main attractions is due to the absolutely amazing restaurant staff at the breakfast buffet. They are the most attentive and genuinely friendly and caring people. They absolutely made our day start in a great way. Breakfast was delicious and an excellent price too.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Value for Beverly Hills Area”
Reviews.Author: brandslam
Reviews.Content: As is typical with hotels that have a wide range of reviews such as the Crowne Plaza Beverly Hills, our stay fell somewhere in the middle. Not a perfect stay, but far from horrible. I traveled here for a conference at UCLA and the value was good for a 3-star or better property (one of the cheapest rack rates in the area - plus I got an even better deal via Priceline). The property is in the southern end of Beverly Hills, but I still like the location. As a 30-something, I don't mind having to walk 15-20 minutes to visit Rodeo Drive (which is one mile north) or 5 minutes to some shopping and restaurants. There are plenty of eating options around the property, including the hotel restaurant which is pretty good (a little pricey, sure, but aren't all hotels?). You can walk one block south to Pico Blvd to find eating options or head north on Beverly Drive (about a 1/2 mile) and find even more of a selection. I recommend the 200 block of South Beverly Drive (Urth Cafe and Frida Mexican Restaurant in particular). Lots of other options, especially on Beverly that I wanted to try. As for the property itself, some parts of the hotel are a bit run down (the walls and bathtubs for instance) but much of the rooms are updated and the lobby and bar area are nice. Room on 7th floor has new carpet, new beds, new chairs, and a 42 inch HDTV. The towels are low quality and a few things required a call down to guest services (the hairdryer was missing the on/off button, one key card did not work, and a light bulb was burned out) but someone was sent up within 10-15 minutes each time to remedy the problem. As many have stated, internet access is free but the wireless signal in the room is very weak (I tried to connect once and it was too slow to work) but the wired ethernet connection (cable provided) is very fast. Given that the cord can be extended to the bed, I simply used the free wired connection in the room and it worked great. DId not try to use wireless in the lobby area, but since it is likely closer to the hub there, it may work well as others have suggested. The biggest disappointment was probably the television. You have this 42 inch LG HDTV with a satellite dish but most channels either do not work or are fuzzy. You are supposed to get 30-40 channels but in my room only about a half dozen are perfectly clear (some local HD channels, a few ESPN channels, and TNT). The rest either get no signal at all (CBS, HGTV, Discovery) or a fuzzy picture (most of them). Seems like this could be an easy fix, but I don't know. All in all, this property is far from perfect but our stay has not been overly painful by any means. A few adjustments (stronger wireless signals, better TV pictures, and better quality towels) could make a huge difference and would bump my rating from 3/5 to 4/5 easily.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: tookjohk
Reviews.Content: Just before our family of 6 (4 Adults, 2 Children) departed for US I read reviews on trip advisor regarding the Crown Plaza B/Hills, I was disappointed and very worried about our choice of hotel. We decided there was no time to change at this late stage and we would just have to see for ourselves. From the minute we arrived to the minute we left, I couldnâ€™t fault the hotel in anyway. Within in 4 min walk of the front door there is the "Famous Deli" which serves any type of food you can imagine and is very reasonably priced. There is also a little supermarket, launderette, pizza rest, Chinese rest and service station. Within 10min walk there is a large pharmacy and supermarket, family restaurant and lots more. 5min in a bus and there is the "Westside Mall" which has most major shops with a food hall and cinema. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful. Santos in particular was great. We organised transport through the hotel with "George", he was very flexible, helpful with good service. There are buses are going past the door every 15-20min and they were easy to use. We requested interconnecting rooms which were we given and this worked really well. The rooms are not huge but were clean. The beds were double but were super comfortable with good pillows. It was difficult to get onto computers sometimes. The General Manager was friendly and helpful and provided some good tourist tips. We would definitely stay at this hotel again and we thought it was good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TruckCompany2025
Reviews.Content: I had a very nice trip and I was pleased with Housekeeping.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Option”
Reviews.Author: Gladiator67
Reviews.Content: We moved from a fancy hotel in BH after a business confernce and found value proposition excellent. Not plush, but the staff and management were very accomodating and seemed to understand hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible location”
Reviews.Author: KeitaLee
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on reviews from this website only to realize that the location is terrible. There is nothing nearby and hardly any restaurants within a short walking distance. Rodeo drive is only a few blocks away but the distance between each block is quite far, it took us around 25 minutes to walk to rodeo drive. I would recommend that you stay in Hollywood if you have free time at night and want to walk around, the shops open until around 9pm and there is plenty to do. Taxis cost us $30 from our hotel to Hollywood!

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Believe what they say, if & when they do say anything”
Reviews.Author: fpg09
Reviews.Content: Where to start! Waste of money, not family friendly, staff are not helpful except for one, rude, arrogant, condescending. Everything was not close by, short walk to anywhere was more that 20 minutes away. Staff trying to get into room when do not disturb sign up. People trying to get into your room at 4am Lift not working for entire stay, lift button stuck on our floor so for nearly 72 hours everytime the lift was called it stopped on our floor dinging and doors slambing. Staff rude to my wife when she asked about hiring a stroller. Staff to us there was not shopping centre close by at all yet when seeing another person in the building staying there we find out that there was one not even a 5 minute walk from the motel. You need to have a car to get anywhere from this place, they try to convince you that their town car/limo is cheaper when you then find out that a cab fair is 90% of the time cheaper. Tried charging us for meals in our room, tried charging us for bottled water not used, tried charging us for a weeks worth of parking when we didnt have a car & I had to argue the point to prove we didnt have a car they even tried saying my wife had the car & I didnt know she had one. Restaurant is heck no comment. All in all do not waste your money or time, this was the worse part of our trip & the most expensive part excluding having to catch cabs from there. Dont bother to complain if you stay there they will only try to silence you with 10% of your food bill, and when you complain to their head office they do not reply. Wi fi in rooms doesnt work either when asked what was the problem I was told to call their service provider, found out it would work if i say on the window ledge, we were only on the 4th floor.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate Hotel with few frills”
Reviews.Author: iainb
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in Sept 2009 with my wife and 20 year old daughter. We were on the 11th floor with great views out over LA towards downtown. he hotel is about a 10 minute walk to Rodeo Drive and there are a number of diners and eating establishments nearby. There is also a supermarket on Olympic Boulevard which is about 5 minutes away. The hotel itself is a no frills Crowne Plaze. The rooms are clean and tidy if uninspiring. The room service is adequate. There was tean and coffee making in the room. There is free internet access in the foyer ad the concierge desk will help with any queries and travel needs. I would stay here again if only for the fact thatI know where everything is. The Chinese Theatre is about a 20 minute Drive away and Universal Studios is about 30 minutes by car. I would do the hop on hop off bus if it's your first time in LA as its a great way to see around the city, the 3 loops take a full day to complete.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and spacious room!”
Reviews.Author: danielawj
Reviews.Content: I come to LA often for business and I choose the Crown Plaza as my home away from home for three reasons: 1- GREAT SERVICE, everyone is always very attentive and smiling. They even have a plate of fresh fruit arriving for me in the room. They often accommodate my request for a higher floor which gives you great LA views! 2- LOCATION is great and walking distance to shops and restaurants. There are many restaurants and cafÃ©s within a 20 min walk from the hotel. You can opt for a light dinner at Earty CafÃ© or splurge at Spagos by Wolfgang 3- GREAT DEAL. I saw their rates go as low as $139 which for Beverly Hills/ West Hollywood area is a great! Trust me, I come to LA all the time and have searched many hotels! If you come here on a regular basis talk to their sales department and they might be able to arrange a corporate rate for you. So a few tips: â€¢ donâ€™t bother with the hotel restaurant, you have way better options close by. Head right on Beverly Drive from hotel and you will see them start to pop up after you the 5th block or so. â€¢ Sign up for their free rewards program and you get a parking discount. From $20 to $15/day . And you get points for your stay. I have never come been here on vacation so I canâ€™t really speak for those kind of travels but I think the hotel is pretty centered to many attractions ( by car) . LA is so big that it will be hard to find one spot that is close to all, so this place is right in middle ï�Š

Reviews.Title: “Tired and Expensive”
Reviews.Author: mowman9
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Crowne Plaza Beverly Hills based on our experience of the one at the Gold Coast in Australia and you couldn't compare the two. The service was poor and unfriendly the building is very out dated and tired not to mention the price of the meals at the restaurant. The name is miss leading as it suggest it would be in Beverly Hills.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for the price. Conveniently situtated within walking distance of good places.”
Reviews.Author: rip1331
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 3 nights while he was attending some training here in Beverly Hills. The hotel is nice and clean. The housekeeping staff does a good job of keeping the rooms clean. The rooms are rather small and the bathroom is even smaller and is situated strange in the room but everything worked well. The hotel staff did not seem very knowledgeable about the surrounding area. I asked for assistance using the public transportation and they had no idea. I also found the cost of a cab to the airport to be rather high ($40 one way) but this is out of their control. I just wish there had been some kind of shuttle service. The hallways were loud and you can hear everyone as they talk and can also hear the doors slamming. If you want to sleep in, don't stay here. The housekeeping staff going in and out of the rooms as they clean gets rather loud. We had drinks at the bar each night and found it to be nice with very friendly staff but the drinks were pricey. All in all, this hotel was adequate for the price we paid in the area it is in.

Reviews.Title: “Quite Good”
Reviews.Author: BA1aSilverstar
Reviews.Content: I stayed here over Christmas time - it is a bit of a walk to get into the middle of Beverley Hills but I would advise taking a taxi. This hotel is perfectly fine for a Crowne Plaza - room service was ok but breakfast was better - extensive buffet and typical hotel lounge park but good to relax after the theme parks.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: xvicx
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 5 nights on the last part of a trip to San Francisco, Las Vegas and LA. We arrived at about 4pm after a trip from LAX which cost $50 in a taxi on the way back to the airport we left in rush hour and the hotel provided us with a private car for $50 so we didn't have to rely on the taxi meter to get us there which was helpful. Staff were good and check in was smooth we were given a room on the 10th floor with a view of the pool and front street of the hotel. Rooms were a good size and clean as was the bathroom but furnishings could have been a bit newer except the tv it was a 37inch flat screen! Hotel was a lovely location in Beverly Hills with Rodeo drive a ten minute walk away. There is plenty to see and do around the hotel but I do recommend a car for LA as last year it was much easier to get around the city.

Reviews.Title: “Don't do it!”
Reviews.Author: MavDubai
Reviews.Content: This was the worst hotel in a 5 city trip! My husband and I were shocked at the poor level of service here. There seemed to be no manager there to make sure the staff had its act together. The 'business centre' was 2 ancient computers with terribly slow internet speed. Plus the rooms were really old and not renovated. The carpet looked dirty and little things like no soapdish in the bathroom and an empty tissue box just added to our misery. I truly felt like switching hotels but didn't as our rooms were prepaid and I didnt' want to go through the hassle. SIncere advice - don't pick this place!

Reviews.Title: “hotel is tired and sub-standard”
Reviews.Author: liberty08
Reviews.Content: This has to be the worst Crowne Plaza we have ever stayed in in our lives. It is run down, tired and the rooms are small and poorly maintained. The restaurant was closed for dinners due to 'lack of business'. Avoid this hotel like the plague!

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: Dan1113
Reviews.Content: When thinking back about this hotel I had a hard time coming up with something to say really, which is good overall I guess: nothing stood out but no real complaints! We used it pretty much just for sleeping (arrived late) but the area seemed ok. Friendly staff, nice standard rooms. Only annoyance raelly was the parking -- pretty expensive espiacally when we noticed the nearby citybank parking garage which was way cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rawlonski
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel, quite, clean and all staff were very helpful. Bed was king size and very comfortable. food was great, bit out of town but Taxi service was on hand 24/7

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently located and classy”
Reviews.Author: BFDStein
Reviews.Content: Within walking distance to Rodeo Drive, easy access to the airport and several city hotspots. Service was good, rooms were clean, and you definitely felt part of the city scene. Very upscale clientelle too. Excellent restaurant, room service, pool, amenities, etc. I had a very pleasant stay. Free wireless internet - VERY high-speed, always a plus! Cabs were readily available out front. Convenient part of town to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “Sound proofing between rooms needs improvement”
Reviews.Author: champagnecaviar
Reviews.Content: As a frequent business traveler I have stayed at many Crowne Plaza hotels and have never been disappointed. Our experience at the Crowne Plaza Beverly Hills was a disappointment. Overall we really liked the hotel. The service was quite good although there were no bellmen to help with luggage upon our arrival. We liked the large screen television. The king size bed was extremely comfortable. However, the room did seem quite small and cramped for two people. The pool area was quite nice with chaise lounges and patio tables. We had planned to spend 6 nights at the hotel. However, on the 2nd night the room next to ours was occupied. We were awakend by our neighbor who arrived at his room at approximately 1:30 AM. He was not particulary noisy. however, we could heard everything through the walls. He made a telephone call which lasted for about an hour and we could hear nearly every word that he said. The next morning the front desk clerk, Tina, was extremely helpful and offered to move us to a different room on a "quiet" floor. I asked if the sound proofing on that floor was any better but I did not get any assurance that it would be. We made the decision to check out on the 3rd day and move to another hotel. We probably would have stayed the 4 remaining nights if it were not for the sound proofing problem between the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great USA Hotel - A+++++++++++ Service”
Reviews.Author: James674
Reviews.Content: After arriving at this hotel having previously stayed there before, we were greeted by the friendly warm staff. When we got into the room, it was clean, well presented and exactly as I had remembered from a previous stay. Sadly, after arriving, we were advised that a family member had taken ill and had only days to live. We told the staff who arranged a car for us to get back to LA International airport, fully refunded our stay and couldn't help us enough at this traumatic time. It was wonderful to see such EXCELLENT customer service. Overall I rate this hotel so highly as it is really well located, is clean and is well maintained. It has great facilities and the staff cannot be faulted, they are wonderful. If you need a well priced place, close to all ammenities then this is one I recommend. Well done Crowne Plaza Beverly Hills, you've done well!

Reviews.Title: “Great if you can get a deal”
Reviews.Author: blondie_bunneh
Reviews.Content: I would definitely stay at the Crowne Plaza again if I got the same deal through Hotwire. For the price, it was a great stay. We booked a king room and after some shuffling behind the front desk, they ended up putting us in a kind handicapped room on the Club Level. I don't know if Club Level is really that different from the rest, but nice touch anyway. The beds are huge; probably a California king. As are the bathrooms, but that could've been due to the handicapped accessibility. They give you a cute sleep kit when you check in that has lavender aromatherapy spray, an eye mask, ear plugs and a sleep CD. The there is a nice array of toiletries, too. The beds are pillow top and come with two different types of pillows (foam and down) so you can pick your comfort. One upside is that WiFi is free, but it's a bit on the wonky side. It constantly cycles as you use it, so uploading is problematic (we were trying to upload travel vlogs - couldn't do it). The location is good, easy to get anywhere and with a Coffee Bean around the corner. The valet was quick and friendly. The big problem with the room is that the temperature sensor is right near the register, so it kicks off not long after the a/c turns on. We had to turn down the a/c to 58 degrees to get the room to cool down and it seemed like the bathroom never got cold. Yikes! Pros: Location Comfy bed Free WiFi Fridge and microwave Cons: WiFi prohibits large uploads Very limited gift shop

Reviews.Title: “Worst customer service of my life”
Reviews.Author: Clod13
Reviews.Content: Location, rooms, cleanliness are not the best but just quite OK. Nothing is elegant just as the website wants you to believe. The bath is probably the smallest bath I have ever seen in a 3* hotel. But what just blew my stay was the service at check-out. I had a position on my bill that was not correct. I had rented a car for 3 days of my 6 days stay and used the self-parking for 1 night. But my billed showed 4 nights of self-parking which was impossible as I had returned my car 2 days before departure. I was shown their car list for overnight parked cars and guess what, my car was indeed on the list. How can that happen? Well, it doesn't matter because neither the reception manager nor the parking manager believed my statement. The parking manager even went to the Hertz rental across the street to inquire when I had given back my car. He came back saying that I had given it back just the night before. WHAT?? I was furious. So I went to Hertz myself, got the express return slip stating the return date and return time and showed it to the reception and parking manager as proof of my words. Embarrassed silence. Unfortunately their apologies were rather meager. The receptionist still wanted to bill me with 2 nights of parking. I had to remind her that it was only 1 night. Honestly, for putting me down as a thieve and a liar I would have expected the entire parking sum to be deducted. This experience made my stay, that up to that moment wasn't terrific but quite OK, the worst stay in my life.

Reviews.Title: “Good rooms and location, but common areas worn out”
Reviews.Author: silverthief2
Reviews.Content: I stayed for two nights, and was on the 10th floor. Received a welcome basket from Priority Club including fresh fruit, cheese, crackers, and Grey Goose vodka, which was much appreciated. And the room was spacious and comfortable. Downsides were the common areas of the hotel: elevators to pool and in parking garage are very worn out and need to be refurbished; same for the stairwells, hallways, and gym. The lobby and pool are the only places that look fresh and clean. Also, note that the internet is heavily filtered. The hotel's location is very good; you can eat on the cheap (Chipotle, Cold Stone, etc.) or try something a little nicer right down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Not So Clean!”
Reviews.Author: LVEH
Reviews.Content: In my opinion the brand Crowne Plaza should be a guarantee of good hotel! I was wrong. 1.) The hotel is not really at Beverly Hills. 2.) The bathroom is TINY and very dirty (even after my complains with the staff). 3.) The laundry service fail. They should return my clothes but they did it just on the other day! What if I checked out ? they would return my pants in Brazil !? Despite of that, the breakfast is good and the concierge very helpfull.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location, room quality, and value”
Reviews.Author: lroden
Reviews.Content: Looks blah on the outside, but inside the rooms it's a 5 star hotel, and it's in the center of Beverly Hills, 5 min to Rodeo Drive, Century City, etc. Amazing bed, giant flat screen TV, incredible toiletry stuff, refrigerator, coffeemaker, hairdryer, iron, CD player, 2 line phone, free wireless internet, 24 hour business center, et a. The staff was SUPER helpful and considerate. The only problems were: garage elevator out of order, and parking is $20 per day, not cheap. Got a great room rate of about $130 thru Hotwire - incredible value for this quality and location.

Reviews.Title: “Should have Stayed at the Marriott across the street!”
Reviews.Author: smoovy
Reviews.Content: While the staff at the Crowne Plaza are friendly, the property is old and not well maintained. The rooms are extremely small for LA. We are in a room with two beds, and the beds are barely big enough for two people. The bathroom is tiny and outdated. The internet connection has been down for two days with no estimate for when it will be up again, so the staff have sent us across the street to the Marriott Beverly Hills to use their internet. If I had to plan the trip again, I would have stayed at the Marriott...it's much nicer than the Crowne Plaza.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: Maty C
Reviews.Content: This hotel was wonderful, originally we wanted a hotel in Santa Monica, but the prices were terribly high! I found a great rate at holidayinn website. Didn't know what to expect I had never been to L.A. The staff is great, specially in the restaurant. The reception staff were very helpful at giving us directions to go to Hollywood and Santa Monica, they even gave us a map. The concierge arranged to have us picked up for the tours so we didn't have any trouble at all. It's near the Beverly Center were you can take the hop on hop off LA tour. One bus away from Santa Monica. Try the Strawberry and Chicken salad at the restaurant, I loved it.

Reviews.Title: “A little out of the way for me”
Reviews.Author: BrisCaz
Reviews.Content: This hotel was booked on the recommendation of my Travel Agent. I must say I was a little disappointed - especially with the room they first gave me which was just looking over the main entrance and street. I got them to change me to a better room on the other side with a nice view of LA. Still I had paid quite a lot for this place and I think I was expecting a bit more. The rooms are average and the bathroom is old fashioned and quite small but the beds are very nice and the toiletries in the bathroom are good. The welcome sleep pack is a nice touch though mine was missing the CD - not that that mattered. I didnt like the location though. It was just that little too far removed from anything. I probably would never stay here again but I cant knock the place - if you have a car then this place is ok. The staff on reception are very nice too and very helpful however one thing I would watch out for is the hotel "car" - they charge exhorbitant rates to unwary travellers as I found to my dismay. I ended up using cabs s they turned out much cheaper in the end even with traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, welcoming and delightful”
Reviews.Author: marjSanDiego
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I had the pleasure of spending 5 nights at the Crowne Plaza Beverly Hills several weeks ago and I have to state that everyone, starting at the Reservation Desk on up to Robin Allison, the Corporate Sales Manager, were delightful! The beds were soooo comfortable, the rooms very clean, and the view from the 11th floor window was lovely. And we really enjoyed our meals at Marty's Bistro. I particularly enjoyed the Priority Club welcome party and had fun talking with Robin and Tony, the co-hosts. All in all, it was a very restful and enjoyable stay...and kudos to the very hard working maids who contribute greatly to the enjoyment of the rooms! Love the shampoo and conditoner, by the way...where can I find the brand? : )

Reviews.Title: “Great Affordable Location”
Reviews.Author: katcourt
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay here on the advise of a friend that said the location was central to sites and studios in the area and the hotel was a good value. They were right on all counts and the staff could not have been nicer and more helpful in getting us directions and dinner reservations. The rooms were in very good shape and the property appears to have been recently remodeled. The pool area was nice and sunny in the afternoon which was nice after a day out walking Rodeo drive which is about a mile away. For the location, price and service we will definetly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The Jewel In The Crowne”
Reviews.Author: doratheexplora
Reviews.Content: We won this holiday on the radio, when we arrived at LAX we were met by a shuttle service approx transfer time was 1 hour due to traffic and other drop off's. Check in was very straight forward they asked us if we would like to leave a credit card imprint or not, there was no pressure to do so. The room was a decent size with 2 queen sized beds and a large bright bathroom with shower and bath. The room also had a CD player and a large television and coffee maker. The ice machine was just down the hallway. The location of the hotel was a little out of the way and without a car it would have been a struggle getting about. I can highly recommend the car hire company under the hotels parking lot. Breakfast was excellent and plentiful. Overall for location and facilities this hotel was a little overpriced but what the heck it cost us nothing ! I would stay here again as it made an ideal base for a fantastic holiday and will be in our memories forever.

Reviews.Title: “Good Surprise”
Reviews.Author: gwendolyyn_USA
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel, because we needed to be in Beverly Hills for 2 nights, and the Four Seasons was sold out. Well, that turned out to be a good thing for us. I will no longer jump to spend over $500/night to stay at this Four Seasons. There's nothing wrong with the Crowne Plaza, at one third the price. You get a comfortable bed, Spectravision, good housekeeping, a very decent room and a great location. And it doesn't cost a fortune. NOTE: If you need quiet, which we do, make sure to book the top floor. It's the designated quiet floor. We were fine up there. No, it doesn't compare to a 5 star hotel But, neither does it's price. For what it is, it's above average. Don't be afraid to use it.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: mayogalIreland
Reviews.Content: Despite a slight hitch when checking in, I had a very pleasant experience in this hotel. The reception area has a nice upmarket feel to it and the reception staff were very helpful. Complimentary citrus water was provided as was free internet access. The room itself was clean, very comfortable and quite good value for money.I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away at all cost”
Reviews.Author: sonyaviation
Reviews.Content: We stayed there 3 days out of a weeks stay in the area, Nice hotel, small rooms but the noise from people working in the hall ways was horrible, not 8 to 5 during the day but 2-3 in the AM. They have all Mexican workers doing the work who not only work all hours of the day and night but they also sleep in the hall ways and the linen closets. I called several times to speak to the hotel manager and was told but the front desK that he was looking into it but never seen anyone take any action. People where so pissed over the noise they where checking out 4 am. As I did at 5 am on the third day of our stay because of the fighting in the hallways in the middle of the night.The mother company of Crown Plaza gave us $500 for our trouble and picked up our other hotels tab. The hotel itself is run %100 by Mexicans and they harbor people not only in the stairways but the parking garage for cheap labor on the hotels refurbishing. STAY AWAY AT ALL COST !!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Got an upgrade”
Reviews.Author: salswife
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this hotel in the small hours of the morning and were given a room on the 4th floor. When we tried to get into the room the lock was on the door so my husband went down to reception to find out what was going on. We were told that sometimes the locks do catch, but that we would be given an upgrade to an executive room on the 12th floor. Room was large and had a king size bed. Bathroom not very big but adequate with plenty of towels, hairdrier and cosmetics. On the bed was a gauze bag with earplugs, sleep mask and lavender linen spray. We had breakfast in the dining room and both the buffet and the ala carte menu were good, large servings and well cooked and presented. The staff were very attentive and friendly. Also ate dinner there one night and thoroughly enjoyed it. Reception staff were very helpful when I needed to find a book shop, even providing me with a map so I knew exactly where I was and how far the book shop would be. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed My Stay”
Reviews.Author: alohaguyHonolulu
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Crowne Plaza for five nights. The check-in went smooth, the room was spacious and clean, and the restaurant and bar offered tasty and reasonably priced food and beverages. The staff was friendly, knowledgeable, and answered all of our questions with skill. The hotel location was great and convenient to numerous Beverly Hills restaurants. Within a ten to fifteen minute walk up Beverly Drive were food establishments in all price ranges, boutique shopping, and upscale Rodeo Drive. I would recommend the hotel to anyone without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “So-so property in a location I didn't care for”
Reviews.Author: Modern_Art_Lover
Reviews.Content: This hotel was okay. The room was fine. Food was below-average quality and choices on the menu were narrow and humdrum. This matters. The neighborhood offers few alternatives for eating, and all require driving, knowing what you're looking for, and parking when you get there. I stayed for 4 nights, 3 on business and one extra night. Beverly Hills is a place I was doing business, so that's why I stayed there. I found out that 90210 is not my style. (By the way, this hotel is technically in Century City, just over the line from Beverly Hills.) L.A. has a lot to recommend it in culture and scenery, and I found little of that in this part of town, although my upper-floor room did offer a city view that was nice. The exercise room was cramped and creekity -- substandard, especially for a hotel in this price class.

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: seat_1A_traveller
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is one the worst I've ever had the misfortune to stay in! However, it holds the Hotel of the year award for 2001 for the chain. But hey do not appear to have any clean bed sheets. I found black hair and big yellow puddle stains on the sheets, mattresses and comforters. I requested to move rooms and the new room had the same problems. Housekeeping came and tried to clean the bed but had to open new sheets because the replacement sheets also had stains. This Hotel is one the worst I've ever had the misfortune to stay in based upon the quality of the bedroom. What a disgusting Hotel! I checked out the same day.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but room was a bit small.”
Reviews.Author: MightyClong
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had overlapping business trips to LA, so I joined her a few days early. She was booked @ the Crowne Plaza in Beverly Hills & I stayed 2 nights with her. The first thing we noticed was that the staff was extremely nice & helpful. According to my wife there was problem w/the original room (I never saw it as I was unloading the car), but we were immediately switched to another room (on the 11th floor...unbelievable view). The room was a little small (especially the bathroom...just big enough to shut the door & turn around in), but adequate. The room had all the expected amenities & a microfridge. The bed & pillows were EXTREMELY comfortable. The bar/lounge seemed nice, but the restaurant was average at best. Overall, a very nice place!

Reviews.Title: “Not rodeo drive, but excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: ale_esteves
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel located a few blocks from rodeo drive (20 min walking) with lots of facilities. The room was very confortable, bed was great, lots of pillows to choose, spacious. Bathroom was good, though a little bit old. For LA you have to have a car, so the hotel is quite nice located. The beverly drive has some shops and a lot of restaurants, which are worth looking at. you can walk to rodeo drive, and take a cab back, better than trying to find a parking place. hotel has a garage, about 16 dollar/day, free internet. restaurant was ok, but very dark and old. we did not have breakfast there, but they brew starbucks coffee there. there is a supermermarket around the corner, where coffee and fresh pastries, bagels, etc are available, so best option for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Liked the hotel but reception staff were a bit dizzy”
Reviews.Author: SSLM
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Crowne Plaza for 4 nights with husband and 8 month old baby. We were part of a large group and had 7 rooms booked at the hotel. We arrived and booked in but this took a while as the receptionist didn't really know what she was doing. Eventually we got checked in and went to our rooms. Reception also misadvised 2 of our party and said they were only booked in for 3 days instead of 4 which was incorrect but did cause us to worry. The room was clean and tidy and had a large VERY COMFORTABLE bed, the rooms were quiet and dark and we had a good view (we were on the 9th floor) the room also had tea/coffee facilities which was great for us to warm bottles/baby food. Breakfast was buffet style or you could order off the menu, the food was tasty and they had a good selection also they were accomodating for babies and had high chairs available. Hotel is well placed in Beverly Hills and was just a short walk to supermarket, bars and restaurants and is close to Rodeo drive. Felt safe walking round in the evening. Spoke to the concierge to book a trip to see stars homes etc.. and we got a really good deal as there were 13 adults and 2 infants, we were able to hire our own mini bus to take us to all the major sights and we could stop when we wanted to take photos. We also booked the minibus to take us to and from Universal Studios and to the aurport which worked out much cheaper than using standard taxis. Would stay at this hotel again as it is very clean and comfortable and in a great location, they just need to train their reception staff a bit better.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks Bobby”
Reviews.Author: broddles2
Reviews.Content: My Grandaughter and I stayed here in November 2007. We loved the Hotel ,although it was a bit far away from places where we wanted to see. We used the valet service most times and found this excellent, the drivers were great and very helpful. We can't speak highly enough of the doorman, come porter Bobby who went out of his way to help us with our tour problems. We had to leave a day early but this was no problem with the desk staff, once again thanks to you all

Reviews.Title: “Not what you expect!”
Reviews.Author: NettaJane
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Crowne for 6 nights. Just because it is in Beverly Hills does not mean it is top of the line. The rooms were very small. The bathroom was rediculously small (take one step in, turn around and sit on toilet, step in shower, or wash hands. Prison cells are bigger than this). Staff was very pleasant and helpful. Bartender not very friendly. Plenty of sitting space in lounge and check in area. We stayed on the 8th floor which included a small refrigerator (nice admenity).

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FFTPQ
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Crowne Plaza for 2 nights as part of a 4 week US honeymoon. The travel agent recommended this hotel for a short stay. The room was of a good size, though the bathroom was absolutely tiny (I have found this across most of the US), only one person could be in there at a time. The staff were friendly and helpful, the lady at the little tour desk downstairs could not do enough to help us with booking our tour. There was a lot of Australians staying here which we really liked. As we were really only in LA for about 36 hours it was hard to tell if it was an ideal location or not, but we enjoyed it while there. We walked a couple of blocks to find quite a few restaurants down Sth Beverly Boulevard and chose one of these to eat at the first night. The second night we took a cab and managed to get into Mortons for dinner and it was divine. Overall, a good place for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: tecouag
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located. The rooms are big, with all what you need for a confortable stay, including this dream box for relax that Crowne Plaza has on all their rooms. Conveniently located, minutes ago from Teathers, Shopping Malls and all the action you might look for in Beverly Hills. Staff is friendly and they have a nice self parking lot. I really have very good memories of this hotel, that will be a good option for my next trip to Beverly Hills

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Perfect for the business traveler.”
Reviews.Author: Blaize76
Reviews.Content: I was only in town for a short period, but the Crowne Plaza really made my stay enjoyable. The "Sleep Kit" complete with lavender spray, ear plugs and eye mask were just the icing on the cake to a down comforter and pillows. The only negative I have is the parking garage which is in need of some major sprucing up, but my room, view and total experience was wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Don't be fooled by the location or title”
Reviews.Author: mas709
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights on business and it was easily the worst experience at a hotel I have ever had. You would think with the Crowne Plaza name and Beverly Hills location, it would be great, but don't let the name fool you. The first night I stayed on the 4th floor and it was a disaster - close to the elevators (mistake #1), the A/C unit worked, but the smell coming out of the vents was absolutely hideous and I had to sleep in a 75 degree room with the A/C off. While doing some work, I noticed a random, previously unknown to me insect crawling up the wall. It was pretty large and left a nice mark on the wall, after crushing it...good times. The room itself is slightly larger than a broom closet, with the bathroom apparently being an afterthought...a very large person could literally not walk through this doorway, without turning sideways - not an issue for me, but keep it in mind if it applies to you. To top it all off, the "free Internet access" was painfully slow. They provide you with the cheapest cat5 / ethernet cable I have ever seen, so my biggest tip to the business traveler is: bring your own network cable! They do offer wireless, but I got a whopping 1 bar (i.e. very low) signal strength on my laptop, so it was useless. I changed rooms after the first night and moved up to floor 5, which was much better, but the overall experience could not be undone...not to mention the fact that the room rate was $249 / night, which is absurd for the subpar quality of this hotel. My last visit to the Century City area had me staying at the InterContinental on Ave of the Stars. This is a phenomenal hotel, that I could not more highly recommend. Look for my review of this on TripAdvisor as well and do yourself a huge favor by staying here instead!

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what it says on the tin”
Reviews.Author: travelbearLondon
Reviews.Content: We struggled to find a hotel in Los Angeles central to all the things we wanted to see, Disney, Santa Monica, Hollywood, the studios etc so plumped for a nice area and a well known brand and thatâ€™s exactly what we got, huge rooms, decent business class service and a hotel that was equal distance from all we wanted to see. You have to have a car to stay here as it is quite a way from any action and having stayed in a number of areas of Los Angeles in the past I would probably still opt to stay out at Santa Monica and travel into the Beverly Hills attractions. Having said all that there is nothing to be said to fault the hotel Iâ€™m just not keen on Los Angeles as a city.

Reviews.Title: “The Good, the Bad, The Ugly”
Reviews.Author: Hatetofly006
Reviews.Content: Good: The rooms were quiet, clean, and spacious. The staff was friendly and helpful. The beds were very comfy. This hotel is located on a residential street, half a block up from an arterial (Pico) so it seemed neighborhoody but was conveniently located to several good places to eat. The neighborhood is obviously Jewish, with quite a mix of Israeli restaurants and more Brooklyn feeling delis. Bad: The bathrooms are small and our shower drained slowly. There was only one "put this sign on your bed if you don't want clean sheets" sign in our room; we put it on one bed and hand wrote a note to housekeeping to please change the other bed, but neither bed was changed. A minor thing. Also, I booked with a conference rate and it was a bit of a hassle to make the booking. Ugly: Each evening and morning there was a least one staff member taking a smoking break right in front of the lobby doors! You couldn't come and go without being poisoned.

Reviews.Title: “Abysmal treatment at the Crowne Plaza Beverly Hills”
Reviews.Author: Zabriskie
Reviews.Content: We had two rooms booked at the Crowne Plaza Beverly Hills which were booked by our tour operator approximately six months ago. On arrival in LA we mistakenly went to the Crowne Plaza beside LA airport (our tour operator gave us the wrong address). When we attempted to check in there they directed us to the Crowne Plaza Beverly Hills, but only after phoning them first to confirm that we were definitely booked in there. When we arrived at the Crowne Plaza Beverly Hills at approximately 7.45pm, having driven almost 400 miles that day to get there, we were told that we were on the guest list, but that our rooms were not available, as some other guests had wanted to extend their stay! They offered to book us into the Intercontinental Hotel for the night, but then had the audacity to say that we that we should come back down to the Crowne Plaza in the morning for breakfast! (They told us this was only about two blocks away, but in fact it was about six). When we asked if our rooms would definitely be available the following night the receptionist did not seem too sure. He at least seemed a bit embarrassed by the situation, but the other receptionist on duty implied that we should be grateful that we were going to a five star hotel instead. What was even more annoying was that shortly afterwards a large party of Russian tourists arrived and checked in, so they obviously did have rooms available. The upshot of this was that when we arrived at the Intercontinental (in a taxi paid for by the Crowne Plaza, after a struggle) we realised that it was indeed a far superior hotel, and our tour operator was very helpful in arranging for us to stay there for our second night in LA too.

Reviews.Title: “It could offer more”
Reviews.Author: AndreaSP
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Crown Plaza Beverly Hills for 4 nights and the only thing I can say is that it was just ok. When booking the room, I asked for an early check-in, if possible (at 12:30 PM, instead of the regular 3:00 PM). Arriving there, my room wasnâ€™t ready and they didnâ€™t make too much effort to find me another one, so ok, I went out to have lunch and, returning after 3:00 PM the room was available and fine. Next day, I went down to have breakfast and they told me that I had booked a room with continental breakfast. So, if I wanted to have the hot dishes (full breakfast) I would have to pay extra USD 5. Ok again, USD 5 is not much, but I think it was ridiculous that they booked a room with continental breakfast, if they had full breakfast available. Ok, I could have paid the extra 5 bucks, but why didnâ€™t they include it in the room rate? I found it very constraining that waiter had to check what I had for breakfast in order to issue the bill. For this kind of details, I guess it was just ok.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay at the Crown Plaza Beverly Hills”
Reviews.Author: haloslightlyaskew
Reviews.Content: I have recently returned from a holiday in the United States and chose to stay at the Crown Plaza Hotel in Beverly Hills for an initial period of five nights from the 23rd to 28th September 2007. Due to some accommodation problems in New York I had to leave a few days earlier than I anticipated. I contacted the Crown Plaza Hotel and arranged two nights accommodation for the 16th & 17th September so that I had somewhere to stay once I arrived in Los Angeles. It also gave me time to try and organize for the five nights that I booked to be moved forward, subject to availability. From the moment I arrived at the hotel I was impressed with the level of service. I arrived at approximately 11pm on the 16th September, 2007 after flying from New York to Los Angeles. I had not been able to access the internet at all while I was in New York (as I use broadband not wireless internet services) and realized when I got to my room that it looked as though only wireless internet was offered. I made a general enquiry with one of the staff, who organized to send someone up to my room within 5 minutes. I was advised that the hotel could still accommodate broadband Internet access and would just need to hook up a cable. Given how late it was I advised the gentleman that I was happy enough to wait until the next morning to get things sorted out. To my surprise he offered again to connect up the cabling, which only took another few minutes, stating that after arriving late that I might like to sleep in the next morning and the internet would be ready to access whenever I needed it the next day. I was so grateful for this level of service, particularly late at night. I then noticed the Sleep Advantage pack on the bed â€¦ after unpacking a few things I had a shower â€¦ put the cd on â€¦ a few drops of lavender on my pillow and got into what can only be described as the most comfortable bed that I have slept in while staying in a hotel. I quite honestly thought I was in heaven. What a fantastic idea, especially for people either arriving at the hotel late and/or after a long flight. Despite a lot of problems being caused through the company that I originally booked my accomodation through, I did manage to stay the 5 additonal nights, mostly due to efforts of two of the Managers at the Hotel, Mr Cruz and Mr Page. I cannot express my gratitude enough to them for their professionalism and genuine desire to ensure that I was able to stay the five nights that I had paid for and be able to continue my stay at the hotel. The level of service offered by the staff at the Crown Plaza Hotel continued to impress me the entire seven nights of my stay. All the staff were friendly, professional and couldnâ€™t do enough to ensure that my stay at the hotel was the best that could possibly be offered. I would not hesitate to stay at the Crown Plaza Hotel again ... I really had a fantastic stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Ok Hotel”
Reviews.Author: corkmike
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Crowne Plaza. We moved here from the Hilton Anaheim and the Crowne Plaza seemed really small in comparison. The room was a bit tight for four people. Beds were comfortable and there was a good view from the room. The staff were friendly and were helpful when booking town cars etc. With regards to location it is about 30 mins from LAX and 40 mins to Universal Studios. It takes about 15 minutes to walk to Rodeo drive and there are plenty of nice restaurants along the street for a bite to eat. Overall the hotel was nice and not too large but I would probably try somewhere else the next time.

Reviews.Title: “not so great!”
Reviews.Author: microcapper
Reviews.Content: we stayed @ the Crowne plaza for five nights ... We came on a Friday aft to find out our suite was not available due to a customer not wanting to check out??? they gave us 2 rooms instead but wanted the amenities of the suite... we went down to the pool and all i can say is DISGRACE!!!!!!!!!! almost EVERY lounge chair was ripped ,broken or unusable ...there were ashtrays everywhere that had not been cleaned in days!!! food left all over!!!! HORRIBLE!!!! the breakfast at the priority club was OK... do the valet for an extra 3 dollars per night.... all in all... next time i am in Beverly Hills it will NOT be at the crown plaza (Marriot Residence Inn is across the street)

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: TravelerS7
Reviews.Content: I was here for two nights in June: my second stay at the Crowne Plaza. I found it to be very comfortable both stays, and since I often have business nearby will undoubtably stay again. Check in went well, and the desk staff was very helpful. My rooms both times were as requested, and were large, with nice views, lots of light, very comfortable beds, a lounger and an ottoman, and well-apppointed bathrooms, wireless that worked well, quiet.....no complaints, though I agree with those that say that the breakfast is so-so here. However, it is walking distance from several other restaurants. The location is quite convienent for west side activities. A good value for what you get and for Beverly Hills; recommended.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: alecstarlite
Reviews.Content: i work as a travel agent in scotland so take my time to choose my hotels (so dont want to be writing a complaint letter to myself) stayed at the crowne plaza BH begin of july we are a family of four. rooms are a little on the small side for four but the beds very comfy. pool ok (only used it for 1/2 hour). kids up to 12 get half price breakfast buffet. reception staff and concierge were all very helpful. we had a car as we were touring and found the hotel to be handy for santa monica/hollywood etc takes about 20 mins to get to long beach IF the roads are quietish and about 35 mins to six flags which is a must for coaster lovers. yes i would stay at this hotel again. by the way used to valet parking as it was about $2 more than self park.

Reviews.Title: “Okay - nothing special for Beverley Hills”
Reviews.Author: manilow
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a very quiet area of Beverley Hills, which is probably a good thing, but personally I like more activity. There are a few cafes and restaurants along from the hotel, where we visited for breakfast and dinner, after being stung on our first night at the hotel. As one of the previous reviewers said, they add on the tip to your credit card. We also had a waiter knocking on our door asking for us to pay our bill in cash, as the credit card hadn't gone through - I ended up paying well over the odds. Definitely left a bad taste on our first night there. The room was average, but we did have an amazing view of Los Angeles. Rodeo Drive is within walking distance, nice to visit but not to spend. We didn't hire a car, but managed to use public transport to get around Hollywood, Santa Monica and Venice Beach. Venice Beach is a must. Hollywood leaves a lot to be desired, but a walk up to the Hollywood Bowl is nice. Seemingly, the post office along from the hotel, is frequently visited by Kirk Douglas and Tom Hanks, though unfortunately not when we were there!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel,great staff...awesome beds!!!”
Reviews.Author: Yesman78
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Plaza for 4 nights on our trip round California,and after reading a few reviews wasnt sure what to expect.My experiance of this hotel was wonderful.Right from the minute we walked in the stuff were friendly and helpful.The bar staff,room service..the beds!!I could have slept there forever!The only downside was that it was a bit quiet at night around the hotel,but we had been out allday so that wasnt a problem for us. I would stay there again,but you do need a car to see the area. Me personally I find all that Rodeo Drive stuff a bit of a laugh,head for Santa Monica/Venice for clothing etc..much more to see and do.

Reviews.Title: “Above average hotel with good location”
Reviews.Author: dazzystar5
Reviews.Content: The Crowne Plaza is nice, but there's nothing particularly special about it. The parking was actually cheaper than I expected. Because I'm a member of their frequent traveler program they reduced the price to $10 per day for self-park. I was disappointed that breakfast wasn't included, so that was an extra $30 a day just for 2 people to eat at the buffet. The food was decent but overpriced. The location is good, about a 15 minute walk to Rodeo Drive. The beds are extremely comfortable and the wireless internet worked well enough. There were a few areas where I noticed that some improvements could be made, but nothing major. The pool looked very nice and clean, but we never had time to use it. The lounge chairs looked comfortable, and they hotel staff had placed towels on each one. Overall a nice stay and I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lousy”
Reviews.Author: mfratt
Reviews.Content: Worst hotel stay. Reserved King Non-smoking, was given a double smoking, had to wait an hour to be moved to another double non-smoking. Later that night, other guests entered my room with keys given them by the front desk. Front desk said they didn't write down my room correctly. $17 two-egg breakfast was stone cold, toast was missing. When I called for toast, I was given 2 slices of plain bread straight out of the bag not toasted. Walls and floors paper thin, can hear people walking on the floor above and in the adjacent rooms. Hotel smelled. Horrible customer service. One bellman also concierge and valet. Worst hotel stay ever. Front desk did nothing to make ammends for all their mistakes and sending people into my room at night when I was in bed!

Reviews.Title: “Good location and rooms, inpersonal service”
Reviews.Author: Warwickfamily
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights in LA at the end of our Complete North America tour. The Crowne Plaza is in a good location with good restaurants a few blocks away and convenient for shopping, beaches etc. Like anywhere in US, a car is really needed to get around, which we had. The rooms are pretty good and are clean and comfortable. The swimming pool is pretty poor, very cold and in a permanently shadey location - no sun morning or evening. The service was not great and the people on check-in fairly inpersonal. Breakfast service was not very friendly and when the waitress wrote her own tip amount on my credit card slip I was fairly taken aback. I know American's expect tips simply for turning up to work, but I've not had one give herself a tip at my expense before!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, not great tourist area”
Reviews.Author: gmw2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Crowne Plaza for 2 nights at the end of our world tour. The hotel was nice, clean and the staff were very friendly. We were given a large room on the 7th floor. It was surprisingly big, with 2 double beds. Free internet access at 2 computers in the lobby is available, tho there is usally a queue. The 1 major complaint I have with the hotel is the location. There isn't much to do after dark. There are a couple of nice places to eat on Pico. One diner which serves amazing lunch and a pretty pricey restauant both about 5mins walk from the hotel. But other than that, there's nowhere to hang out. Rodeo Drive is a good 15-20min walk and here you'll find some eateries on the way (bring your visa card!). We struggled to find places to shop. After saving alot of money to go mad here, I came home with alot of it! Also, car hire is a must. We had been warned of this before but decided that as we were only here for 2 days, and were arriving on St Patricks Day (we're Irish) so didn't want to be unable to enjoy a drink....anyway, we spent a fortune on taxis and I'm convinced they went halfway round the world for a short cut so be careful! The slight negative thing I would say about the hotel is that we tried to order room service. Albeit at 10.50 when they stop at 11, but they made no effort to find us an alternative or offer something that takes a few minutes to rustle up. Other than that, no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Could use some improvements”
Reviews.Author: macabee
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel in a great location and very reasonably priced. I stayed on a low floor and my window looked directly into someone's apartment, whose windows were open, so I had to close mine. The bathtub drained extremely slowly, and the bathroom showed age. The mattress and showerhead were new and comfortable. The staff was great and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “So this is Beverly Hills?”
Reviews.Author: Lee S
Reviews.Content: I had no issues with the Crowne Plaza at all. The room was clean and comfortable. I guess I was expecting a little more from Beverly Hills itself. Rodeo Drive is a nice hike from the hotel, and smaller than I envisioned. The map of BH the hotel provides is somewhat deceptive as it omits several streets and makes places appear closer than they actually are. The immediate area around the Crown Plaza has a gas station, Ralph's, Longs, and a few restaurants/delis. There really wasn't much of a night life I could find.and it seemed like most places shut down at 5. I probably wouldn't stay in BH again, but if you really wanted to tell others you spent the night in Beverly Hills, the Crowne Plaza would be a reasonable choice.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: kenthewizard
Reviews.Content: Reviewer: Stone, UK Stayed at the hotel for 2 nights early October. No real issues with the hotel, it's one of those that does what it says on the lable - provides you with clean and comfortable room close to the amenities. Would I stay there again? Yes without a thought if all I was looking for was a central base to take in the sights. No issues with the staff who are both very helpful and knowledgable.

Reviews.Title: “A nicely located hotel with friendly staff and good services”
Reviews.Author: Aldis
Reviews.Content: We had a good time here. The room was nice, the staff were very friendly and accomodating to our family. Its an easy walk to cafes and restaurants nearby and the neighbourhood felt very safe to walk around at night, even with small children. The pool/ jacuzzi was an instant hit with our 7 year old. Its the sort of hotel that grows on you because the staff make you feel comfortable and at home, which is what you want on vacation. I've stayed in a lot flasher hotels which I've left feeling not as satisfied as I did staying here. They could do with another internet computer though- one doesn't seem to be enough at busy times.

Reviews.Title: “Most Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: JayS44
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 10 nights at this location while on a family vacation. The location was great and the staff was excellent. They were helpful in every manner possible. The rooms were spacious and clean (we had a suite) and free internet was very useful. John the Conceirge was great at recommending attractions and giving directions. Many useful amenities were close by including a Ralph's supermarket, numerous dry cleaners and many resturants. Would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lilian_Rastignac
Reviews.Content: This is the second time that i stay at Crowne Plaza Beverly Hills. The 1st time was 5 years ago. At that time, i really enjoyed the hotel. Now, i've just returned from Los Angeles and i can assure you that Crowne Plaza Beverly Hills remains a really good choice. The room is very clean and confortable. The bathroom is perfect and, in addition to this, i found very sweet the gifts that they offer to guests: a relaxation CD and lavender essence. In addition to this, you can find at lobby free hot coffee/tea in the morning and lemonade in the evening. Great place to stay and relax.

Reviews.Title: “Very workable business hotel.”
Reviews.Author: boberonicus2
Reviews.Content: Free Wireless, although all web content is monitored. Free in/out car valet service is $18, parking $15. Fast room check in. Smoke-free room. Walked in and found the A/C on, radio on, newspaper, etc. Working desk with decent chair. Lighting was OK for reading. Nice big pool. Free toothpaste (was planning to buy some). Workout room is cramped, and only one treadmill, but at least its a professional model. No complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Okay for What You Pay”
Reviews.Author: TEF2125
Reviews.Content: This was a very average hotel. Very small bathroom. The hotel is called the Crown Plaza, Beverly Hills, but it's actually in the city limits of Los Angeles, just across the border from Beverly Hills. If you want a clean, safe, relatively inexpensive place to lay your head, this hotel will do the trick. You must have a car to get around. No public transportion nearby. Close to Hollywood and the sites. You cannot have a roll away in your room if there's already two beds in the room. They will only allow a roll away if you have a room with a king bed. This is important if you have your family and usually get a double with a roll away. For an extra $5, you can upgrade your breakfast from the free Priority Club breakfast to the buffet. It's worth the $5 to upgrade unless you only eat fruit and toast for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price”
Reviews.Author: JuniorMan
Reviews.Content: If your heading to Beverly Hills and dont want to spend too much on a Hotel, (After all , your not going there to sit in your room all day) this hotel is great. The Staff are friendly and fantastic. The guys who work at the door are fantastic. Would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Reliable option in Los Angeles”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Crowne Plaza Beverly Hills for 3 days in June 2006 and I have to say I have only one real complaint, although the complaint I have is not to be undervalued. We arrived, a little after 3:00 pm and were told that our room was not ready. This is, of course, a little unnerving after travelling for about 7 hours, but understandable if the problem is taken care of quickly. We waited for over an hour before being let into our room, which was not even made up, to drop off our luggage. We decided, rather than sit in the hotel and wait for our room to be cleaned, we would go exploring. We came back to the hotel, several hours later and our rooms were finally cleaned. This was the only real complaint I had during our stay, but as I said it is a really big complaint. The best thing about this hotel are the beds. I have stayed in many Intercontinental hotels, most recently in Atlanta, and I must say they have the most comfortable hotel beds I have ever slept in. It is good to see that Intercontinental has made the commitment to upgrade the Crowne Plaza hotel range bedding as well, even if there was no feather-bed. The hotel decor is very much like a Holiday Inn, but this is considered a value hotel and no one should expect the Ritz when staying here. The continental breakfast, served in the mornings for Priority Club members, is a wonderful value and just the thing to start a busy day of exploring and shopping. Another hotel perk, so to speak, was the use of the 24 hour fitness gym about a 1/4 of a mile down the road from the hotel. The facility has workout machines, free weights, cardio machines as well as organized classes, which can all be accessed by Crowne Plaza guests for free. Now, as for the hotel's location, anyone coming to Los Angeles should understand, that no location in Los Angeles is ever entirely convenient. If you do not have a car it is very hard to move around the city. The Crowne Plaza is only a 15 minute walk to Rodeo Dr. and is right on Beverly, which has a number of restaurants and shops, all within walking distance of the hotel. If you can handle a tedious check-in, as we did, The Crowne Plaza is a reliable value-hotel option in Los Angeles, within reasonable driving distance to many attractions, and offers guests comfortable beds, complimentary fitness center privileges and a good continental breakfast. What more can someone ask for in this price range.

Reviews.Title: “Expected more”
Reviews.Author: SuperTJ
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for three nights based on reviews from tripadvisor. After arriving on a 13 hour flight, we just wanted to check in and sleep. We were told our room would be ready in half an hour and they would let us know when it was ready. We waited patiently in the foyer.... two hours later I asked what was happening and was told "Oh, sorry, I forget to let you know - your room was ready over an hour ago". Exhausted and frustrated we finally made it to bed. The room was nice - spacious and clean. But, the walls were paper thin and we were kept awake at 1am with television and converstation in the next room. We could hear word for word what they were saying. I am a priority club member and was given the free breakfast which was very good. On the last day the concierge arranged for a town car to take us to the airport. Five minutes after booking, he called our room to confirm that it was indeed booked. When the town car never showed up, we asked the bellman about it, who asked somebody else who said "oh yeah.... he cancelled". Five minutes later we were told that it was never booked at all. We were left to find our own way to the aiport. The location is in the middle of nowhere. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and friendly”
Reviews.Author: kkcsydney
Reviews.Content: We stayed April 20 - 22 and thought it was a very comfortable room with terrific bed and pillows, however, the bathroom was sufficient but small. The staff were very helpful and friendly (especially when my husband became ill one night) and they were of great assistance and concerned for his well being. Room Service tray very well presented especially with fresh flowers and mints. The Hotel was also in a good neighbourhood. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: andrewt3233
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights at the beginning of our 15 night stay in the USA. Booked the hotel through the Holiday Inn website (as a Priority Club Member - which is free to join!) Was very surprised at the rate quoted - only $99 + Tax. We booked a 2 x Queen Bed Room - Non Smoking. Upon arrival at the hotel (following the excellent driving instructions from the website) we were checked in prompty and very effeciently and directed to our rooms. As a Priority Club member tey have special floors in certain hotels - we arrived at our rooms and were very very impressed wth what greated us. High floor, view of LA with the Hollywood sign in the distance, 2 Queen beds with Feather Duvet, feather topper and great pillows, air conditioning that worked and welcome letters from the General Manager and Priority Club Manager. Crowne Plaza also have recently introduced a Sleep programe - so on the bed was a CD for helping you to drift off into a deep sleep, some lavender pillow mist, ear plugs and an eye mask all very nice little touches. Used the hotels Valet parking at $18.50 per night - to be honest it is more cost efficeint to use the hotels self parking at only $14.00 per night - as it is under the hotel and you dont have to keep tipping the concierge everytime you need your car keys. As a Priority Club member this also entitles you to a free continental breakfast which includes juices, tea/coffee, yoghurt, cereals, bagels, muffins. You can also upgrade for $5 to the buffet breakfast which we did on one morning and had a cooked breakfast.
